data.what_is:
Iterable is a customer communication platform that brings together real-time customer data and the ability to create experiences to activate customers across channels in record time--we help brands deliver joyful experiences with harmonized, individualized, and dynamic communications at scale. 

With intelligent personalization solutions powered by Iterable AI, individualized dynamic content capabilities of Catalog, and a best-in-class suite of cross-channel personalization tools, Iterable helps brands redefine their customers' experiences. 

By making Iterable the focal point of your modern growth stack, you can create a seamless experience for your customers across email, SMS, mobile push, web push, in-app notifications, social and more. Learn more at Iterable.com.
data.product_description: Iterable empowers growth marketers to create world-class user engagement campaigns throughout the full lifecycle, and across all channels. Marketers segment users, build workflows, automate touchpoints, and test strategies at scale without engineering support.Iterable empowers users with the right data and technology to deliver customer experiences at every touchpoint.* Unlock more data: Store richer, more complete customer data and build deeply personalized journeys. With more data at your fingertips, you'll deliver highly relevant recommendations that increase customer loyalty.* Leverage your data's potential: Iterable can easily ingest data from almost any source in real-time, so you're always working with the most up-to-date information.* Transform insights into smarter marketing decisions. With Iterable's advanced AI capabilities, identify target segments based on unique goals, better understand predictions, and optimize campaign delivery.* Reduce Costs: Consolidate the marketing technology stack. Lower the cost to build a better, more digitally oriented experience* Increase Lifetime Value: Drive more engagement and repeat purchases and customer loyalty via connection in the moments that matter.* Drive Subscription Revenue: Convert more visitors and drive conversions with engagements across the entire customer journey.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Based on 239 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Based on 237 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: Based on 185 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: Based on 229 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Based on 232 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Based on 240 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies. 133 reviewers of Iterable have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Based on 217 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Based on 239 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Based on 149 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application.

features.name: Optimization
features.content: Based on 119 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Optimizes marketing campaigns for mobile devices.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: Based on 215 Iterable reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Budgeting
features.content: Manage all aspects of marketing investments, including assigning top-down budgets to various groups and divisions, planning marketing spending across programs, tracking open-to-spend, ensuring budget compliance, coordinating work-flows and permissions, and reconciling plans with actual invoices. 148 reviewers of Iterable have provided feedback on this feature.

features.content: Monitor what leads and contacts say on sites such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, blogs, and online communities. initial_reviews.review_title: Iterable user for the last 6years
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
. Everyone at Iterable is extremely kind and supportive and always willing to find an answer to our questions no matter how big or small the question. The Platform itself is very easy to use, and the Campaign section is very detailed in the way you can use experiments for a/b testing.

Iterable's ability to be willing to adapt over the years to customer needs really and creating their roadmap around feedback,most other esp don't do that, and it's always long roadmap timelines

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I think the hardest thing about iterable is not having native integrations in tools to our tech stack where we can pull in just specific fields as a marketer without an engineer to set up the webhook and piping for us.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
I highly recommend Iterable they are genuine, good natured company with employees that truly care about your success. You won't regret the switch, we have an extremely complicated business model and they accepted the challenge and worked with us very closely during migration and we still work with them closely.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating an Omichannel solution for our company.

New company we are trying to understand our consumer base better, and retarget uses by utilizing our internal data, to better connect with our audience.

initial_reviews.review_title: Intuitive user interface, solid customer service
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Overall iterable has served us well at Hipcamp. Previously I've used Braze, Mailchimp and Hubspot and Iterable was very easy to pick up. Additionally Mike our account manager has been awesome! Very responsive and helpful.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
As a marketer I wish I was more autonomous with things like setting up custom events. It'd also be great to have machine learning pick the best comms to send to users and when, though sounds like y'all are moving in that direction after hearing from your SVP, Product. Also creatively, there are often blockers with fonts, dark mode etc-- so better optimizing creative for the users domain would be helpful.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's an extension of the product for things like trip communications, cancellations, modifications etc.

Introduces our new users to the product, inspires them to book, and brings them back again. Drives substantial growth!

initial_reviews.review_title: Amazing customer service and high-quality cross channel marketing platform!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
1. Iterable Team: From the moment we started working with them, their team was there to guide us through every step of the process. They provide expert advice, support and very quick to respond to any questions or concerns our team ever has, they always go above and beyond to ensure a smooth resolution.

2. Product: It's one of the best I've seen so far. The platform is highly intuitive and easy to use, with a robust set of features that enable our teams to create targeted and personalized campaigns that resonate with my audience.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I don't dislike anything about the product or the team so far

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. Customer Segmentation
2. Personalization
3. Marketing automations

All these capabilities help us with quick turnarounds and achieve efficiencies at scale

initial_reviews.review_title: A powerful marketing automation platform with a robust API, live chat support, and a slick UI.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has made building complex journeys a breeze. With a modern UI and intutive tiles one can build out and test journeys in minutes. It has a fantastic API with great documentation and live chat support. It offers a myriad of options for allowing contacts to enter a program and continually adds features to enhance the experince of your contacts. It integrates well with many 3rd party vendors and Iterable representatives are always eager to check in with their customers.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
That platform does lack a robust CDN for image hosting that some other platforms have figured out but overall you can add images to campaigns and reuse the source urls in other campaigns if you need to.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are an agency and the grate part of Iterable is that you can have different "projects" represent different clients and also use them to represent lower environments (prod vs. sandbox). It makes the organization of contacts and testing very intuitive and it is very easy to switch back and forth between projects as needed.

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy to use & very capable CRM
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I love the user friendly interface, especially for someone who is coming more from the marketing side, without a ton of technical experience. The flows and journeys are easy to build and the capabilities are very advanced. In addition, I appreciate that Iterable is always looking to improve their product and has a future-oriented mindset, introducing features such as their AI Suite and Copy Assist, which can help automate more of the operational work & inspire new ideas. Not least, our CSM is very involved & helpful with our questions & ideas, so the support is appreciated.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I wish the design editor would have the option to save a specific block inside the ditor, allowing to be re-used in a later campaign (especially for some evergreen elements/blocks of design).

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable's data feed capability helped solve one of our most time-consuming work, namely work with multiple languages and across multiple markets, using one single template that fits all. It's also highly capable in terms of using simple html and basic coding for allowing different visuals/different discounts/different prices to be shown to the right customer, which again, is extremely helpful when doing global marketing.

Also, Iterable's journeys are very easy to build, often very intuitive, and have complex capabilities --> which help automating more of the manual efforts and save a lot of time for a CRM manager.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Iterable?
review_question_answers.answer: I love the user friendly interface, especially for someone who is coming more from the marketing side, without a ton of technical experience. The flows and journeys are easy to build and the capabilities are very advanced. In addition, I appreciate that Iterable is always looking to improve their product and has a future-oriented mindset, introducing features such as their AI Suite and Copy Assist, which can help automate more of the operational work & inspire new ideas. Not least, our CSM is very involved & helpful with our questions & ideas, so the support is appreciated.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Iterable?
review_question_answers.answer: I wish the design editor would have the option to save a specific block inside the ditor, allowing to be re-used in a later campaign (especially for some evergreen elements/blocks of design).

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
Iterable's data feed capability helped solve one of our most time-consuming work, namely work with multiple languages and across multiple markets, using one single template that fits all. It's also highly capable in terms of using simple html and basic coding for allowing different visuals/different discounts/different prices to be shown to the right customer, which again, is extremely helpful when doing global marketing.

Also, Iterable's journeys are very easy to build, often very intuitive, and have complex capabilities --> which help automating more of the manual efforts and save a lot of time for a CRM manager.

initial_reviews.review_title: Seems good enough, but want more intelligence
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
It works, as. Product manager I am able to do a few ad hoc sends when I need to and our marketing team is good with it too

What do you dislike about Iterable?
We are the brains still behind what is sent to customers. It would be better if we could create candidate push notifactions and candidate parts of emails and have iterable choose to send those when.

I.e we have one push notification for national park week and another for perseids meteor shower. We had to choose which one to send that week. If instead we could upload these two (and thousands more like oer friendly stays, where to camp for phish concert, etc) to a "black box"  and set it to send our users 1 push a week and let it optimize send time and  which com to send each user to maximize bookings we believe we could see a step function change in the effectiveness of our comms.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lifecycle marketing

initial_reviews.review_title: Intuitive and customizable marketing channel platform
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is a very adaptable platform for the various diverse needs that my company and I have. We utilize Iterable not only for our own fairly straightforward D2C communications, but we're able to use Iterable's project settings to create unique platforms for our enterprise clients.

For example, we have one project with a client where their agents are set as the users. User profiles update automatically when a new customer is logged with an agent/user, which in turn triggers emails (representing events at different parts in the sales funnel) to the agents with a CTA to reach out to said customer. It's a very cool application that meets the unique needs of this particular client, and Iterable has been the perfect the platform to accomplish this.

I would also be remiss not to mention how great the Iterable team is at listening to customers wishes and requests and making frequent platform updates and improvements. In the almost two years I've used Iterable now, I've seen some really cool and handy features drop that have improved my own experience.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
While I'm savvy enough with programming languages, I am still a sucker for platforms that incorporate a lot of functions into a user-friendly UI. Iterable is most of the way there, but still has some functions that I think could stand to head in this direction.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Right now, how to adapt to the various and unique marcomm requirements of multiple enterprise partners.

initial_reviews.review_title: A Robust, Intuitive ESP
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is an easy to use, intuitive ESP. Coming from company that uses lots of dynamic fields and templates, I  am impressed with the amount of data that Iterable is able to hold and reference. Additionally, the customer support through the platform and through our account representative is immediate and helpful.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The journey capabilities could be further built out to allow things like a send limit per day (not just per minute). We sometimes have to come up with creative workarounds for features that do not exist, such as a daily send limit.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable allows us to automate most of our email marketing campaigns. This prevents us from having to build net new emails daily in order to keep the program running. Secondly, Iterable's features allow for a lot of testing, which helps us learn about what works and does not work.

Iterable allows us to populate data in dynamic templates and fields live. This is a small feature that saves us a huge amount of time. We are able to test different versions of the email live in the platform as opposed to having to build out numerous templates and or having to send proofs to our inboxes to view different versions of dyanmic templates.

initial_reviews.review_title: Seemless, competent & a great experience
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The team who supported us during the intergration and implementation stages, plus those who support us ongoing have been fantastic, nothing is too much of an ask! (Very refreshing vs other suppliers!)

System wise, i use it every day, and the interface is really simple, clean, and easy to use  - again very different to other systems i've used.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The only downside is the template management aspect. When you create a base template and then add it to the campaign, if you update the base template, it doesnt automatically update the template within the campaign (so you basically have to update your templates twice).

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Previously we had an over complicated system, which looked like it was built in the 90s.  You had to be a develper to user it, and it was just not what we needed. Iterable has cut down the time it takes to create campaigns, automate our campaigns and communicate to our customers - allowing us to be more agile.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I have been able to see many different people be trained to use Iterable using their provided training moduals and I am impressed at how easily new users gain proficiency with the system. That being said, there is enough depth to be able to handle our automation and communication needs completly without the need of external systems. I use Iterable every day and am impressed with how versatile and easy it has been to impliment across our organization. We have many systems that we needed to tie into iterable and their support team has been very helpfull ensuring that it has been done in a timly mannor.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Due to the scope of the product it takes a while for specific requested features to be implimented. They are constantly developing new features but many of them are not usefull to my organization and how we use the product.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
They provide a foundation for all of our communications. We are a large organization and being able to integrate Iterable into our old systems has been invaluable. As we consolidate and remove older systems Iterable has been able to accomidate and step into a greater role in our organization.

initial_reviews.review_title: Iterable helps keep our ever-changing marketing goals organized and optimized.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I appreciate the granularity with which Iterable's segmentation tool has been created. It's a huge help to be able to create a variety of dynamic audiences within seconds, and then apply them to ongoing campaigns without needing to manually update details every day. It makes deploying campaigns much easier to execute, and allows us to work more quickly too.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The reporting tools in Iterable leave much to be desired. There isn't an easy way to understand daily engagement within an ongoing campaign, nor is there any kind of 'scroll depth' tool to measure our users' engagement beyond the click.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable helps us keep multiple brand databases organized and allows us to set-up a variety of automated marketing campaigns to make sure that we're always reaching out customers, regardless of what demographic or target audience they might fall into.

. Everyone at Iterable is extremely kind and supportive and always willing to find an answer to our questions no matter how big or small the question. The Platform itself is very easy to use, and the Campaign section is very detailed in the way you can use experiments for a/b testing.

Iterable's ability to be willing to adapt over the years to customer needs really and creating their roadmap around feedback,most other esp don't do that, and it's always long roadmap timelines

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Overall iterable has served us well at Hipcamp. Previously I've used Braze, Mailchimp and Hubspot and Iterable was very easy to pick up. Additionally Mike our account manager has been awesome! Very responsive and helpful.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
As a marketer I wish I was more autonomous with things like setting up custom events. It'd also be great to have machine learning pick the best comms to send to users and when, though sounds like y'all are moving in that direction after hearing from your SVP, Product. Also creatively, there are often blockers with fonts, dark mode etc-- so better optimizing creative for the users domain would be helpful.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's an extension of the product for things like trip communications, cancellations, modifications etc.

Introduces our new users to the product, inspires them to book, and brings them back again. Drives substantial growth!

all_reviews.review_title: A powerful marketing automation platform with a robust API, live chat support, and a slick UI.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has made building complex journeys a breeze. With a modern UI and intutive tiles one can build out and test journeys in minutes. It has a fantastic API with great documentation and live chat support. It offers a myriad of options for allowing contacts to enter a program and continually adds features to enhance the experince of your contacts. It integrates well with many 3rd party vendors and Iterable representatives are always eager to check in with their customers.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
That platform does lack a robust CDN for image hosting that some other platforms have figured out but overall you can add images to campaigns and reuse the source urls in other campaigns if you need to.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are an agency and the grate part of Iterable is that you can have different "projects" represent different clients and also use them to represent lower environments (prod vs. sandbox). It makes the organization of contacts and testing very intuitive and it is very easy to switch back and forth between projects as needed.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use & very capable CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I love the user friendly interface, especially for someone who is coming more from the marketing side, without a ton of technical experience. The flows and journeys are easy to build and the capabilities are very advanced. In addition, I appreciate that Iterable is always looking to improve their product and has a future-oriented mindset, introducing features such as their AI Suite and Copy Assist, which can help automate more of the operational work & inspire new ideas. Not least, our CSM is very involved & helpful with our questions & ideas, so the support is appreciated.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I wish the design editor would have the option to save a specific block inside the ditor, allowing to be re-used in a later campaign (especially for some evergreen elements/blocks of design).

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable's data feed capability helped solve one of our most time-consuming work, namely work with multiple languages and across multiple markets, using one single template that fits all. It's also highly capable in terms of using simple html and basic coding for allowing different visuals/different discounts/different prices to be shown to the right customer, which again, is extremely helpful when doing global marketing.

Also, Iterable's journeys are very easy to build, often very intuitive, and have complex capabilities --> which help automating more of the manual efforts and save a lot of time for a CRM manager.

all_reviews.review_title: Seems good enough, but want more intelligence
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
It works, as. Product manager I am able to do a few ad hoc sends when I need to and our marketing team is good with it too

What do you dislike about Iterable?
We are the brains still behind what is sent to customers. It would be better if we could create candidate push notifactions and candidate parts of emails and have iterable choose to send those when.

I.e we have one push notification for national park week and another for perseids meteor shower. We had to choose which one to send that week. If instead we could upload these two (and thousands more like oer friendly stays, where to camp for phish concert, etc) to a "black box"  and set it to send our users 1 push a week and let it optimize send time and  which com to send each user to maximize bookings we believe we could see a step function change in the effectiveness of our comms.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lifecycle marketing

all_reviews.review_title: Intuitive and customizable marketing channel platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is a very adaptable platform for the various diverse needs that my company and I have. We utilize Iterable not only for our own fairly straightforward D2C communications, but we're able to use Iterable's project settings to create unique platforms for our enterprise clients.

For example, we have one project with a client where their agents are set as the users. User profiles update automatically when a new customer is logged with an agent/user, which in turn triggers emails (representing events at different parts in the sales funnel) to the agents with a CTA to reach out to said customer. It's a very cool application that meets the unique needs of this particular client, and Iterable has been the perfect the platform to accomplish this.

I would also be remiss not to mention how great the Iterable team is at listening to customers wishes and requests and making frequent platform updates and improvements. In the almost two years I've used Iterable now, I've seen some really cool and handy features drop that have improved my own experience.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
While I'm savvy enough with programming languages, I am still a sucker for platforms that incorporate a lot of functions into a user-friendly UI. Iterable is most of the way there, but still has some functions that I think could stand to head in this direction.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Right now, how to adapt to the various and unique marcomm requirements of multiple enterprise partners.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is an easy to use, intuitive ESP. Coming from company that uses lots of dynamic fields and templates, I  am impressed with the amount of data that Iterable is able to hold and reference. Additionally, the customer support through the platform and through our account representative is immediate and helpful.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The journey capabilities could be further built out to allow things like a send limit per day (not just per minute). We sometimes have to come up with creative workarounds for features that do not exist, such as a daily send limit.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable allows us to automate most of our email marketing campaigns. This prevents us from having to build net new emails daily in order to keep the program running. Secondly, Iterable's features allow for a lot of testing, which helps us learn about what works and does not work.

Iterable allows us to populate data in dynamic templates and fields live. This is a small feature that saves us a huge amount of time. We are able to test different versions of the email live in the platform as opposed to having to build out numerous templates and or having to send proofs to our inboxes to view different versions of dyanmic templates.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The team who supported us during the intergration and implementation stages, plus those who support us ongoing have been fantastic, nothing is too much of an ask! (Very refreshing vs other suppliers!)

System wise, i use it every day, and the interface is really simple, clean, and easy to use  - again very different to other systems i've used.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The only downside is the template management aspect. When you create a base template and then add it to the campaign, if you update the base template, it doesnt automatically update the template within the campaign (so you basically have to update your templates twice).

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Previously we had an over complicated system, which looked like it was built in the 90s.  You had to be a develper to user it, and it was just not what we needed. Iterable has cut down the time it takes to create campaigns, automate our campaigns and communicate to our customers - allowing us to be more agile.

That being said, there is enough depth to be able to handle our automation and communication needs completly without the need of external systems. all_reviews.review_title: Iterable helps keep our ever-changing marketing goals organized and optimized.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I appreciate the granularity with which Iterable's segmentation tool has been created. It's a huge help to be able to create a variety of dynamic audiences within seconds, and then apply them to ongoing campaigns without needing to manually update details every day. It makes deploying campaigns much easier to execute, and allows us to work more quickly too.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The reporting tools in Iterable leave much to be desired. There isn't an easy way to understand daily engagement within an ongoing campaign, nor is there any kind of 'scroll depth' tool to measure our users' engagement beyond the click.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable helps us keep multiple brand databases organized and allows us to set-up a variety of automated marketing campaigns to make sure that we're always reaching out customers, regardless of what demographic or target audience they might fall into.

all_reviews.review_title: user-friendly tool that gets the job done
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable was one of the easiest automation platform tools to learn fresh. It has a pretty clean interface and most of the standard things I want to do with marketing automatino can be done natively, though sometimes take a bit of finagling or a message to Support. Iterable is staffed with a helpful support team who can be reached at all hours via Chat, and if you get set up with the right dedicated account rep they can really help move you in the right direction to meet your business needs.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Iterable has some opportunity to improve their reporting capabilities. This is a common concern across every Iterable user I have ever met, so it's suprising they have not built this function out more. The foldering structure in some sections of Iterable (webhooks, snippets) has not been well-planned and this creates a messy environment to work in and search in. It can also be challening for a non-dev to get the documentation for what tools and platforms can be integrated w/ Iterable or how to set up APIs/webhooks to build more of the ops flows. I'd love to see more user-friendly developer docs!

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our team automates hundreds of campaigns a week for email, direct mail via webhooks, and push/SMS. Iterable allows us to do this at all stages of the funnel, and we are able to iterate on existing flows to make things better.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Our team likes that the service is user friendly and many people in the team can build campaigns even without HTML knowledge. Makes the team-work quicker and the email team is left with time to implement harder innovations into the campaigns.

I like how quickly customer support replies, and they actually email you to see if the issue persists. But sometimes there is not a solid solution that can be given to an issue.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The device previews sometimes give out wrong previews and we spend time fixing some bugs that are not actully there. Also when requesting to see a different (language) version in previews, it gives out EN as a pre-set, and sometimes it takes extra time.

We also had an issue with restoring some versions and then the whole campaign being buggy.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automations really help, as many emails are triggered by customers interactions. I think the connection between our website and the platform are very well done.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I've been in email marketing for 12 years and Iterable is one of the most marketing-friendly ESPs I've used while still boasting a ton of capabilities to create dynamic campaigns. We have a somewhat complicated infrastructure, but Iterable's implementation team guided us wonderfully through the process - making sure every one of our use cases was met and accommodated for. As the primary user of the product, I can build blast campaigns & complex journeys easily and their journey capabilities have opened up multiple customer touchpoints for us.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Uploading images/having an image library isn't *as* straightforward as some other ESPs I've used; however, I do know that they are working on improving this feature and it is in beta, so I'm excited to see what that looks like.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Iterable, we're able to more easily and efficiently get customers the right messages for them at the right time. Additionally, we send custom behavioral events directly into Iterable, and we're able to use those to create dynamic journeys pretty seamlessly.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
One of the standout features of Iterable is its remarkable flexibility and ease of implementation. Whether you're a seasoned marketer or just dipping your toes into the world of email marketing, the platform caters to all levels of expertise. The ease of sending personalized content is particularly noteworthy, thanks to the ability to build specific segments, the use of dynamic fields, and the catalog feature.
Another notable advantage of Iterable is its commitment to continuous improvement, frequently introducing new features that enhance the platform's capabilities. Customer support is always available and responsive.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There is room for improvement in the analytics section. Although the platform provides essential insights, enhancing the analytics features could be great.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable effectively addresses a range of email marketing challenges, offering outstanding flexibility and easy implementation. Its ability to send personalized content ensures messages resonate effectively, and the platform enables the effortless setup of automated and blast campaigns across various channels. Additionally, Iterable's technical excellence stands out, simplifying the creation of advanced workflows and seamless integration of dynamic content into our marketing campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Best thing about Iterable is the support team. They are always there and help you with agility. Special thanks to Haitham, Adyran, Tahmid and all other agents who made my job and life easier.

Of course technically, as a CRM specialist I can tell it is one of the best tools I ever used. I specifically love building journeys. Journeys at Iterable overall are super smooth and fun to use.

Generally it is a highly customizable and flexible tool in terms of campaign design and customer journey mapping. Also, strong automation and personalization capabilities enhance our work everyday.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Building content catalogues could have been more user friendly. For example, it won't read anything from the sheets except just the text. Could have been a lot better if we could copy paste, play around with texts easily. (Bold, bulletpoints, spaces etc.)

About pricing, I think end of the year, being a bit flexible about agreed contract limitations (yearly email sent, users etc.) wouldn't hurt a healthy long term business relationship... It feels a bit unfair that pricing would go dramatically up if we exceed our limits just 5% for example.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
-By delivering personalized, timely, and relevant messages across multiple channels, our businesses can significantly improve customer engagement and increase conversion rates.

-The automation and integration capabilities of Iterable streamline marketing operations, saving time and reducing the need for manual intervention.

-The extensive data analysis tools offered by Iterable allow us to gain deeper insights into customer behavior and preferences, which can help us build future marketing strategies with better insights.

The amount of data that we're able to track in the back end.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It's hard to visualize the points/mediums from which users interact with our brand.
The event history is not friendly enough to efectively visualize the historic interactions from a single user or even a company. It's hard to know if they filled out a form, things that are not necesarily part of the customer journey itself, but happen before the customer actively is looking to purchase.
There's no tying between users / companies.
Visualizing the performance of campaigns lacks functionalities, the way that we can currently filter dates is not intuitive and you need to learn that you should account for more days in order to get the full data range you're looking for.

Wish Iterable could hold forms.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Tracks events and customer data across different mediums.
Helps us set up workflows.

"Wish their event payloads were consistent"

Iterable is not very usefull when it comes to customer retention.
Not a very handy CRM tbh.

all_reviews.review_title: Great ESP with constantly evolving product offerings
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable listens to your feedback and does their best to launch product offerings that are in line with users' requests. They listen to their customers' suggestions more than other ESPs I've worked with, and the product launches they have really do a lot fo improve our segmentation and experimentation abilities, as well as ease of use. The customer can be very, very helpful at times, diving deep to help isolate problems and look for solutions.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Some areas Iterable can improve are on announcing the rollouts for new product launches before they are live and having more webinars and resource docs on these new capabilities. Oftentimes these changes are rolled out and then we are notified and given resources. Additionally, the customer can, at times, do the bare minimum in helping to evaluate an issue and look for a solution. I wish that Iterable would have better plans in place to address industry-wide changes, such as 10DLC and Google/DMARC deliberability requirements. Iterable has lacked in providing resources and solutions to this widespread, high-impact changes in the past, and it would be helpful to have step up and be a true, proven leader in sharing knowledge and actionable steps in cases like these.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable seeks to make their UI better all the time, and the product launches they roll out are very helpful. Things like internal notes in a workflow to help multi-collab internally with teams to new hold tiles, send optimizations, and throttling for better customer journey experiences are just a few of the many offerings released of late.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Put aside that Iterable's interface badly needs to be cleaned up, and you'll see that pretty much all the tools you need to be successful are there. Basic things like STO, subject line AI, and fairly robust workflows are all contained. Nested data structures allow you to keep conversion history fairly easily and manage multiple lines of business. And even though I personally hate working with data feeds, I have to admit they do make life easier. Plus, I've never had a major limitation using Handlebars. It might take a few tries, but there's always a way.

I've migrated two clients to Iterable on top of working with three companies full-time who use them, and it's easily the simplest migration I've managed.

The tradeoff between Iterable and anything else isn't going to be feature set. It's going to be UI and support for more complicated things you want to build. But with the right help from other Iterable users, you'll save a fortune by just not letting yourself get woo'd by a prettier design.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
If you want anything other than basic support, you're going to get dragged through the mud paying for it. So expect 2-4 days for a decent answer on anything more advanced than a question you can find answered in the support center. Mitigate this by finding a user group you can ask questions. Also, solutions architecture isn't wildly helpful from my experience. Again, user groups help this a lot. Lastly, the templates versus campaigns setup is annoying. There should be an option to shut of templates altogether if you're a company who custom codes your emails (which you should).

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email is great, but it's not enough in this multi-channel world. So being able to utilize SMS, push, in-app, and email all in one place allows me to manage communications flow.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable has allowed us to scale exponentially and efficiently.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I use Iterable daily for our marketing efforts. It is a very robust system that allows us to send hundreds of campaigns from SMS, Email, and Push Notifications. We're able to create hundreds of user attributes that connected directly with our system and use that to build and send fully personalized campaigns. Their UI is very easy to use and navigate.

Iterable also have amazing customer service. My company is connected with a CSM that is very responsive. They have the best online support i've seen. Whenever I need help, they usually respond within 2 minutes. 100% recommend.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There's not much to complain about with Iterable. They are always evolving as a company and constantly ask for feedback to help them improve in all areas.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable has allowed us to evolve all our digital marketing efforts. We send over 150,000 campaigns annually, with 90% now being fully automated. One reason why we chose Iterable was their ability for us to fully integrate our system with Iterable through API which allows us to personalize all our campaigns. We've also created dozens of automated event triggers based on how our customers interact with our system/website.

Iterable has allowed us to really scale our business, and as efficient as possible.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I like how easy it is to use, and how you can create target segments based off who has opened, clicked, or who actually received the email. I like how there is a more customizable option for those who know code and a simple version for those who like to plug and play. I like that you can see click heatmaps. I like how you can get a wide variety of statistics from your emails and how easy it is to organize your campaigns within Iterable. I like how easy it is to create lists within Iterable and how simple it is, but also how complex it can get for stricter targeting. I think Iterable has been great for sending bulk emails for our business. I think it also has a lot of capability that we haven't fully used yet.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Only thing I don't like is how you can't see how many clicks you got from sections that send an email compared to those that send someone to a website. E.g. If I have a tile linking out to a landing page, you are able to see this on the heatmap. If I have a photo that leads to an email to send to our business, you can see how many overall clicks the email received, but it doesn't show you which tiles had those clicks and how many individual clicks each tile has on the heatmap.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
It allows us to make automations for customers we want to keep in constant contact with. It also helps us set up reminders for customers when they are expecting service from us. It allows us to create messaging that is personalized to our customers. It allows us to be creative and test different things out, but also allows us to be successful in those tests. It allows you to really personalize what you want to do, and how you want to do that. For automations, we can test different things. For bulk emails, we can test different things. It helps us save time and overall money.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has revolutionized our marketing efforts with its user-friendly interface and powerful features. I have been a user of Iterable for over a year now and we use it 5 times minimum in a month. The intuitive design makes campaign creation a breeze, while robust segmentation and automation capabilities have significantly boosted our engagement and conversion rates. Implementing Iterable is a breeze, thanks to its user-friendly interface and straightforward setup process. It offers seamless integration with various platforms, ensuring a smooth and hassle-free experience for users during the integration process.

What truly sets Iterable apart is its commitment to innovation. Regular updates and responsive customer support ensure we stay ahead in the ever-evolving world of marketing technology. If you're serious about taking your marketing strategy to the next level, Iterable is the platform to choose. Highly recommended for its effectiveness and ease of use!

While Iterable has many positive aspects, there are a couple of drawbacks to note. Occasionally, the links in emails may not work as expected, causing inconvenience. Additionally, users have reported occasional performance issues, with the platform experiencing slowdowns and crashes. This doesn't hinder how

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable has seriously helped us scale and personalize our drip campaigns and multiply our email revenue in less than a year. The WYSIWYG email builder is incredibly simple to use, has many features that other platforms do not, and the load/wait times are sooo much quicker than what I've experienced on other platforms. It even supports light photo editing (resizing, cropping, etc.) within the platform so less need to photoshop for quick and easy adjustments. Being able to do SMS fromt he same platform as email is also a big cost and effort saver.

all_reviews.review_title: My use: looking up marketing correspondence for users
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Once logged in, it's easy to enter the "user" email address and see all the correspondence we've had via marketing (we don't use it for correspondence, just marketing emails).

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It logs me out every single day.  I'm not sure why there isn't an option to stay logged in.  As well, the newest default screen is some sort of a summary, and it's not useful to me at all. Perhaps there is a default way to see the "history" but that's what I need to use all the time.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
When a user complains that they didn't get a renewal notice, I can look it up and see if they did (normally they did) and show it to them. This aids in conflict resolution when we can show them it was sent.

all_reviews.review_title: Migrating to Iterable enabled rapid business growth through its features and superstar team
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- Introduction of catalogue which has enabled us to scale up our revenue generating email products and increase incremental revenue by 55% whilst  cutting down team build time by 80%.
- The ability to seamlessly feed segment data into Iterable to create bespoke audiences using a range of website browsing behaviours and transactional data. Resulting in powerful, real-time campaigns, increasing overall  engagement by 19.5%.
- Account stratgey time and support
- Specialist technical engineering support

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- Some new projects do take time to implement, as we know we are one of many clients, however we are 100% supported throughout from kick offs to launch.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Results have been phenomenal and surpass our expectations daily. The combination of Segment and Iterable has meant we can accelerate both testing and rollout.

- Personalisation at scale;
Ability to efficiently build and deploy over 370 unique personalised email versions using localised market content monthly
150% increase in click through rates, 21% increase in website visits and 300% increase in users tracking a property compared to our previous national 'blanket' message sends

-Smart intent scoring;
Deployed a 'one-to-many' geo-linked intent scoring algorithm using Segment and Iterable together

- Resource constraignts;
Ability to build 50 home of the week emails for our clients in minutes, resulting in 55% increase in incremental revenue in H1
Saving upto 10 hours of build time each week for the team and reduced the risk of rendering/ template errors working outside of the HTML code

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is *the tool* for lifecycle marketers to run wild with. With the right internal resources there are endless possibilities to ingest and leverage data. Journey and campaign creation is intuitive, and the new experimentation UI is equally as impressive.

The team at Iterable does a great job of innovating new products and features that have impact and are immediately actionable. Recent examples that come to mind are the "hold until" tile in journey studio and "frequency caps"  in settings.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Three things: (1) expense and (2) it's not plug and play and (3) not a native B2B tool

Many of the features to unlock true benefit/ROI have a cost associated. It's up to you to determine what your org needs in the near and long-term.

It's not accessible to every marketer - your org needs technical resources to run. Would love to see more plug and play apps/integration. E.g. plug in a "review" content block in template builder, adjust some settings, and be able to populate templates with real/relevant reviews - without needing to code or technical background.

Iterable was also built for B2C brands and you can tell - would love to see more B2B-specific features to solve some of our hang ups.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to achieve highly personalized journey automation in ways that our other martech tools cannot support. Connecting the message to impact and iterating on what isn't working is the secret sauce.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The email builder in Iterable is fantastic and incredibly user-friendly. It's intuitive while not being so basic its restrictive. After using MailChimp for years, it was a breath of fresh air. My team can produce dynamic and much more personalized content with Iterable's features in a way that will allow us to "level up" the capabilities of our program in the very near future. We're excited about the new possibilities, highly recommend!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The Iterable reps have been good so far (leagues and beyond the support we got on our former ESP), but I think we're still wanting more personalized and knowledgeable support. I expect better support will come with time as they get to know our needs as a team, so the jury is still out.  And to their credit, the staff we've interacted with have always gone back and looked for better answers when we've pushed them to dive in deeper, and that's an encouraging sign. In short, we can tell Iterable's team is newer to offering customer support on the level we need. However, I think as the platform becomes more established, their reps will become more proficient. Something to note but overall and long-term, I personally have no concerns at this time.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We desperately needed an ESP that would give us visibility and ownership over automated (triggered) emails without the need for professional developers. Iterable provided that capability to us. We can now handle set up and maintenance of these types of emails with the skills we have as email marketers.

What do you dislike about Iterable?

Expanded journey logic options including AI, which allow for robust automation and personalization. Catalog and Collections as an easy way to merchandise product in commuications. all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The biggest pros of Iterable are:
1. The features that make creating/managing emails and push notifications a simple process. It working with other platforms for translations or template creation is also a plus.

2. The support is great. I've used a combination of their knowledge base and customer support to address questions and issues in many projects. They are always prompt, informative, and ask great clarifying questions as needed.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The biggest challenge I've encountered is with translations. The process of importing translations for push notifications is a lot more complicated than I was expecting, and often I will just manually add in translations.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
I manage our email database, and Iterable makes it easy to edit templates, create journeys, and edit journeys as needs for templates change.

What do you like best about Iterable?
I love how easy it is to build templates, campaigns and journeys. The ability to add a conversion event (that is not just a purchase) within a specific campaign element (i.e. an email or SMS) within a journey has been a gamechange for our monitoring and analytics this year.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I dislike that some of the simpler functionalities of database management that other ESPs have, such as being able to change a user's email address can not be done simply within iterable, but have to be done through API calls on the backend.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am using iterable to for lead nurting, customer development, post-purchase, loyalty and retention.

all_reviews.review_title: Great onboarding experience and excellent ongoing support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Our company transitioned from a large legacy provider of email and other messaging channel capabilities.  A migration of this kind is always daunting, but it truly went about as smoothly as was promised during the Iterable sales process.  Incredible implementation team support was provided every step of the way!

I also love that the ongoing platform operates smoothly, intuitively, and quickly.  Continuing customer success support is top-notch, as well.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The included drag-and-drop email builder tool has given us a few challenges, but it's unclear whether that's just part of the learning curve or an area that could in fact use improvement.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Communicating with our customers in consistently relevant, personalized, and timely ways is vital to providing a positive experience with our product.  Using all available customer information is key to enabling that goal, and the intelligent storage and organization of that data and rapid "what if" segmentation enabled by Iterable really unlocks all of that data for us.

all_reviews.review_content:

It can send emails. It can send broadcast campaigns. It's fairly straightforward to use.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The reporting features are pretty basic. If you want to get more out of reporting or analytics, Iterable on its own is not the right solution for you - instead you will need a third-party analytics tool like Looker, or a CDP like Segment to get your email marketing data out of Iterable and into a platform that can combine all your user data points into a format where you can more easily get insights.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable helps us send emails to our users to engage them and get them to upgrade from free to paid plans. Iterable also sends broadcast emails to our audience to announce our newest features, events, and content.

all_reviews.review_title: A complete platform with great customer service~
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
It's a complete platform to automate your email campaigns, and you can easily create complex workflows. It has useful handlebars and features to segment and personalize the content for your email list. It has a great analytics report in which you can see a detailed breakdown of your campaign performance. Our customer success manager has guided us in navigating the platform and making the most of Iterable's features and updates. Additionally, our email deliverability consultant's meetings have helped us understand how to optimize our process to ensure every email lands in the right inbox.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It would be great to have more triggering options to start and exit a workflow and have more drag-and-drop features to build and design the email layout on Iterable.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Personalize our email content according to users' interests and behavior
Increase our engagement and conversion rate by sending them the right email at the right time
Avoid spammy practices by segmenting and refining our lists

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- The email workflow editor (journey, as Iterable calls it) is quite robust and one of Iterable's most user-friendly and intuitive features.


- The optimization feature for email campaigns is an amazing feature (Send Time Optimization, Quiet Hours, Send Rate Limit) and has proven to improve our engagement rate, as well as reduce our unsubscribe rates.


- Analytics are great and you can really go granular and in-depth; however, if you want a quick overview of a group of campaigns' performance, the Messaging Insights features could have a better user experience.


- Iterable also has a wide variety of features such as catalogs, data feeds, etc, which are quite useful if you're working with big sets of data (i.e. ecommerce products) and want to personalize user experiences.


- The support is great. If your plan type includes live chat support, it is quite effective and the customer support people are very friendly, effective, and well-trained.


- Iterable is constantly testing and adding new features so the user experience is as good as possible.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- The segmentation feature is great, although adding and setting a date property can be very confusing at the beginning, unlike other email marketing tools in which you can easily choose "in the last 30 days", for example.

- The Experiment (AB testing) feature for email is also a bit confusing at the beginning and requires more effort/clicks than necessary.

- Overall, it's not the most user-friendly platform in the market and the adoption process may take a while, but it's definitely a very effective one.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable has helped us achieve our email marketing goals, as well as reduce our churn rates.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable is innovative and support is unmatched
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
What I like the most about Iterable is:
1. Our CSM, Robyn Mucasey. No matter the time or amount of emails, she always gets back to me with a thorough explanation! She makes the effort to lay out and share examples of solutions for us and she always keeps us up-to-date with the latest Iterable developments + provides use cases of how they might be helpful to us.

2. Iterable is always innovating! In the beginning, some of the tools seemed relatively limited but they've updated the experience to be more user-friendly and listen to their customer's suggestions and implement them. They've updated their workflows to include hold triggers, tile sets, sending users to other journeys based on criteria, etc. Any time we share a suggestion with Iterable, it seems like it comes to life in a relatively timely manner.

3. Customer support - sometimes it's hit or miss but for the most part, they help work through problems with you which I couldn't appreciate more. I feel like I'm working in a team that understands my end goal and helps me get there.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
1. I think some of the reporting is limited - although there's lots of data, the lack of graphics makes it less actionable and slightly confusing. You can select a workflow to measure but it breaks it down by campaign rather than looking at it as a whole.

2. The hold tiles have a 30-day limit which is limiting.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable allows us to build comprehensive abandoned cart, post-abandoned cart, and promotional campaigns. Additionally, using the segmentation logic we're able to create upsell drips for behind-the-wheel driving, similar products, etc.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
We use iterable to launch email blast campaigns for multiple different brands. We also use journeys for content onboarding and welcome series. Iterable is easy to use for a marketer. I would say that if you dream it, you can use iterable to build it. I absolutely love using iterable. Their support team is excellent as well. The support team is great when launching a new journey or doing more complex technical tasks. You can ask them questions or even send them a flow to take a look at to give you peace of mind and have a second set of eyes on something.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I would say that iterable is great with all technical aspects. I will say that if something is unfamiliar with HTML or a little inexperienced, it can be a little difficult to build out. But if you ever have any questions, the Iterable support team is there to help you. I would also say that sometimes pulling specific segment analysis is a little difficult. But overall, I really love iterable's platform.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable is constantly improving its product offerings. I also feel like they are continually adding to their product offerings. They take their client's ideas and really listen to the wants and needs of their clients. Overall, I think that Iterable is a great ESP and a great company to work with.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is an esssential tool for our marketing team. I like that it offers great documentation for those who want to learn more about the product and find ways to customize it based on their company's needs. It is user-friendly and very easy to use. The support team at Iterable is the best I have ever seen.  You can always reach out to them when you need help or have questions. Iterable is truly the most intuitive email CRM tool which makes it a geat platform to use on a daily.

I often find Iterable to be a bit laggy. Sometimes the software doesn't seem to respond to action. I always have to refresh the page in order for me to see the changes I've made (this usually happens when I'm working with the catalog and need to make small updates here and there).

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Friendly UI, knowledgeable and resourceful reps, responsive and helpful global support!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
UI is user-friendly, and creating audience segmentation/lists is intuitive, especially getting an estimated count immediately! Both customer service reps and online customer support are very knowledgeable, resourceful, and helpful, whether it's looking into specific account details, providing FAQ articles, or querying data from the backend. In addition, love that the support team is global and works around the clock, I feel like I've gotten close to a few of them and love their attitude, energy, and care.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Although functional, there are times where I wish Iterable had more powerful and useful features, such as a more reliable way to preview emails in different clients, browsers, and devices or more ways to manipulate and analyze campaign metrics. Some of the journey and campaign design could benefit from more granular options/tiles as well, as it seems like there's been times where I'm looking for a workaround instead of using a feature the way it was intended.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable is a centralized platform for us to maintain customer/member data so we can communicate with them across multiple channels. Although we're primarily using the email channel with a hint of SMS right now, our marketing strategy is looking to expand into more of SMS, push, and in-app.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Principal, Email Marketing Operations - Outbound Lifecycle

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to set up journeys and organise campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The journey builders are very intuitive and easy to set up as flows. It's easy to organise and categorize our campaigns.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Not having a place to host images is a bit of a pain. Also the way experiments are launched is counter-intuitive. Usually platforms allow you to 'launch' an experiment and it would just begin when the associated campaign starts sending, but on Iterable we have to time it so that we also launch the experiment just before the campaign. This is unlrealistic for anything we are scheduling ahead of time.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're able to easily report on multiple fairly complex journeys containing all sorts of split tests, gaining invaluable insights into our users.

all_reviews.review_title: Great ESP with awesome support team
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has a state of the art support team that is knowledgeable and always ready to go above and beyond. On the toolset standpoint, Iterable has a talented pool of devs and solution architects who liase with the customers regularly while delivering features. I think this is amazing whereby the builders are in direct contact with the customers' needs. They listen and deliver, which is super important from a customers' standpoint. Iterabel is also super close to our business and our requirement. They understand us and help us in whatver way possible. Lastly, their deliverability team is also very well-equipped and are good in pointing out any potential issues way ahead of time. This allows us to address issues that may have bad consequences otherwise.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Iterable has some 3rd party integrations that provide bits and pieces of their toolset, for instance the drag and drop interface to build email. Neither the customers, nor Iterable seems to have a good understanding of their backlog and prioritizing processes. If issues pop up with these elements it is difficult to address them with proper transparency.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable has become the single-most important marketing tool that we leverage. It enabled us to set up complex automations, triggers and personalization. It integrates well with a number fo 3rd parties seamlessly, like CDP. Iterabel took away the pain in building an email from scratch, so we could put our focus on strategy rather than on execution. It also alolows our marketers to build their own emails without having a specific email-focused operations team.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful email automations with a few bugs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
It's got a lot of functionality -- our team can draft, test, and send messages, but also create templates, automate user journeys, and add extensive dynamic content to emails. We use the Catalog feature to customize product content in our emails, which has been useful. Our CSMs at Iterable have been consistently helpful and friendly. In the year or so that we've used Iterable, there have been several major additions and improvements to the platform.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
A few quirks with the drag & drop editor mean that many emails get drafted in the HTML or WYSIWIG editors, which are overly complicated and time-intensive for simple emails. We've also come across bugs in a few of the more complex handlebars functions that have stumped our team and our Iterable support alike. The reporting is good for static emails but is missing useful analytics for emails with dynamic content. The Catalog interface, when we need to manually make additions or changes, is clunky.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We market different products to different segments across a wide customer base, and Iterable allows us to dynamically create those emails. It also allows us to automate common user journeys.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool and wonderful product support!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The product support is amazing, I have nothing but great things to say about working with the team at Iterable. Beginning as novice users of the platform, they are always quick to respond to questions and provide resources to further our learning. As we've ramped up usage as an organization and carried out integrations with other partners, the Iterable team has been super helpful in making things happen and helping us find solutions to our business needs.
The UI is really easy to navigate and the drag and drop editors make setting up and deploying emails super simple.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I think for marketers without coding skills there is a bit of a learning curve needed to incorporate dynamic content through the use of handlebars. I have utilized other ESPs in the past that were a bit more user friendly in that regard with more prebuilt options for dynamic customization. As a one man email team, I've often found it frustrating that it's hard to action on things I know that the platform can do without a technical resource.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automating email journeys and conducting A/B tests to learn more about the content that resonates best with our audience and what strategies drive the greatest returns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Regarding Iterable's interface, I appreciate the updated layout for setting up and creating campaigns. I also like the option to create a template first and add it to a campaign or create it directly from the campaign editor.

Our campaigns have also benefited from the ease of using handlebars and custom links to bring information.

Customer support has been fast and accurate when we have had trouble.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Despite the platform's user-friendliness, it might take newcomers some time to get used to all the advanced features. Perhaps more comprehensive onboarding resources would alleviate this issue.

While the analytics provided are insightful and helpful, I would appreciate a better customizable dashboard. It would be great to have lists/segments performance, content performance,  custom events performance, campaign comparisons, etc.

I know it is a matter of the current plan we have, but I'd love it if we had more sits for support tickets request.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
For now, the marketing side of our email strategy is supported by Iterable. It has been helpful in running both successful automated and blast campaigns. Also, we have run several AB tests in order to improve engagement rates.
Currently, we are in the process to implement more Iterable features such as catalogs, push notifications, and in-app messages; we are so excited!

all_reviews.review_title: Still the best Omnichannel tool in the business in my humble opinion
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I've used about 15 different platforms and constantly review strong competitors to Iterable. In my view, Iterable still tops the charts.
It has been built by engineers to give as much power to marketers as possible. Its segmentation system is the best I've ever seen, allowing AND/OR/NOR combinations. Its automations can trigger off any custom event or data field. Its templates are extremely versatile, allowing to inject any number of 3rd party source data into them, including solutions like Movable Ink.
Iterable's machine learning game is also very strong, and continually improving. Which leads me to my top reason for recommending Iterable over any other marketing automation platform: it continually and rapidly innovates, making its product always even better than before.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It was hard to find reasons to dislike Iterable. It is not a cheap platform, but then neither are any of its competitors. I find their new campaign reporting to be quite imperfect, but I understand they acknowledge as much and are bringing upgrades to it soon. As I pointed out earlier, whatever isn't the best, Iterable will fix quickly.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable handles all the complex business logic and triggers to lifecycle campaigns. It compiles performance statistics for the whole program. It is also our tool of choice to send out broadcast communications across multiple channels.

all_reviews.review_title: If you can dream it, you can build it
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Highly customizeable. If you have the engineers and the tech, you can build whatever you want within Iterable. We pass through user properties, custom events and event properties that are highly individualized to our business. This allows us to build sophisticated segments and journeys unique to us. There is a lot of capability within the campaign builder, from experiments & dynamic content, to scheduling and organization. Snippets and variables are an amazing tool to make you more efficient and deliver individualized content.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
With a lot of freedom, also come a lot of things that can break. Whether it's on our end, or a bug on the Iterable side, we do often have troubleshooting. Also don't love the way journeys are setup for more innovative SMS strategies.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable allows us to automate our winning strategies for each segment. We deliver highly individualized campaigns based on the actions, behaviors and characteristics of each user.

I'm in Iterable every day, and Iterable is miles better than the previous ESP we were using.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
