all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has grown a lot in the year that we have been using the platform - and our email strategy along with it. They frequently introduce new features that respond to customer needs; their support is quick and usually only requires a couple of emails to resolve any issues. Our Customer Success manager has gone above and beyond to help us make the most of the software.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Iterable has a few surface level bugs that require workarounds. Duplicating campaigns too many times can insert the wrong links into campaigns. There are also some areas where the software doesn't seem to respond to action (e.g. deleting a campaign) until you refresh the page. These are minor, though.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable allows us to schedule campaigns easily and send them at the best possible time for our users through their send time optimization features. It also gives excellent visibility on key metrics, which has allowed us to make our email process more transparent to the rest of the company. This has enabled us to use email more effectively and dynamically with more teams within the business.

What do you like best about Iterable?
Really like being able to automatically port audiences in FB Audience Manager which helps us keep messaging constant based on the part of the funnel they are in.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Reporting. You can only view reports based on when events happend and are unable to switch to when emails were sent. If you want to see the performance of certain emails over a longer period of time and you have had an account for awhile you may so hundreds of emails show up before the 5 you want to look at. Really need to have a naming convention and tagging strategy in place. It is pretty time consuming to create a report or any visualization compared to other types of platforms.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Being able to personalize how we communicate with our prospective buyers and current customers. Their A/B test functionality is great if we want to dive into rentention metrics and see how we can increase our LTV.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable empowers our business with flexible & innovative automation solutions.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The flexibility and capabilities of the platform make it so as long as you have the data, you can do almost anything. Email, SMS, in-app, the capabilities are endless, and with the additions to the AI suite, the platform is getting more and more innovative.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The platform does require quite a lot of prework with development to bring in enough data to make usable, and requires consistent monitoring to ensure data continues to flow into the platform correctly.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable allows us to target both our prospective and existing customers with targeted, personalised marketing across multiple channels. It allows us to continue to plan and innovate for the future.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool and easy to use for marketers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable was very easy to pick up and user friendly for a non-technical users. In our previous platform, we had to rely completely on engineering to set up a campaign, and now there are many tools at my disposal like the drag and drop editor and the segmentation tool that I can build polished campaigns quickly. There is also extensive learning documentation and trainings which were helpful to get up to speed. The support/account management team is really friendly and nice to work with and the pricing is reasonable.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The only downside we've experienced so far is that we cannot utilize push notifications based on the lack of unique device IDs, which allow users to opt out of push notifications per device.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable helps our team create campaigns quickly and without engineering resources. It also is a reliable platform that we trust to deploy automated journeys and manage user settings.

The support/account management team is really friendly and nice to work with and the pricing is reasonable.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable is solution oriented and transparent.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
My team reports only positive things about Iterable's functionality. I, however, can judge Iterable mainly on their ability to understand and adapt to my business needs. As a manager, I value longstanding relationships with vendors. I value relationships where both sides respect and understand each other's needs. Iterable is such a partner to me. When I explained why my business needs changed, Michelle Novak and Ray Moquet found the perfect solution for us, which made me agree to extend our relationship with Iterable beyond the end of our contract.
Furthermore, we will evaluate if Iterable could be the right partner in our other ventures. Finding the correct ESP is difficult these days. I have lost a lot of money making the wrong decisions. Iterable is the right partner, so this will not happen again.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
To this point, there is nothing negative that I can report about Iterable.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable enables us to target the right customers at the right time. We can reduce our opportunity costs drastically by tailor-made messaging. Also, Iterable makes sure that our messaging reaches the client's inbox. deliverability used to be our Achilles heel but not anymore.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I enjoy the ease of reviewing each campaign from the Messaging page and then having the ability to double-click to understand more data about a specific campaign. I also appreciate the heatmap as we are able to see which types of content in the email resonated most with our users.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The confusing jargon that we need to use to create segmentations can be improved. For example, "is on or after" is a very confusing term. I think this needs to be rethought to make it easier for users. I need to utilize a diagram that one of your technical CSM uses for me to make sure I am targeting the appropriate group.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are looking to target dozens of different creator segments with different types of messaging. Iterable is able to help us reach the audiences we need with the ease of a pretty straightforward platform.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Nice flexible data model. Ability to do SDK-less mobile messaging.   They have helpful support and their product features and launches all make a ton of sense.  They enable use to have a single solution for our B2C business and we have been happy customers for over 4 years.   Fair pricing, good support, and generally capable and good people across the board, from their leadership, sales, and customer success.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There is a learning curve for developing automations but frankly, it all is intuitive and makes sense.  More partners and additional Zapier integrations/workflows would be helpful.  Reporting is probably the biggest weakness right now.   Worth reviewing to see how it suits your needs.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Enables us to have a single solution rather than point solutions across touchpoints.  I love this about them.  Unified customer journeys and the ability to have access to powerful tools and more AI is really great.

Any time I have a question, my success manager is very responsive and takes the time to understand my use case so that she can make suggestions.

The integration/API abilities are fantastic, we are able to send data points from across the business and third party tools to make highly intellegent workflows.

What do you like best about Iterable?
Incredibly easy to use, great support via Live Chat

What do you dislike about Iterable?
No folder management for lists, there has been increased levels of journey downtime recently

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're able to easily contact the right customers, at the right time, using the right channel. Simplicity is key.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool, easy to use, however has pain points for our B2B2C marketing needs.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Powerful multi-channel marketing with fast response times even at scale (have used platforms like Salesforce Marketing Cloud where automations would break once was in the multi-millions of users level), fairly easy learning curve

What do you dislike about Iterable?
My organization does B2B2C marketing and the flat data structure has been a detriment for client level customizations that are critical for our business needs

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing at scale for B2B2C consumer marketing campaigns; direct revenue generation

all_reviews.review_title: Full-featured marketing platform with always improving features.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The system is very flexible when it comes to hadling data. Having the ability to reference local Catalogs, data feeds, and event data helps come up with solutions for logistic problems not thought of form the start of a project.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Many options are only possible via the API that should be made available directly from the front-end. In my case, usually options related to exporting/editing Catalog items in bulk.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Adaptable custom email templating has been an issue with other platforms that I have used. A combination of Catalogs, Snippets, and the ability to send truly unmolested, custom HTML has solved issues that other systems could not handle.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Iterable?

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Adaptable custom email templating has been an issue with other platforms that I have used. A combination of Catalogs, Snippets, and the ability to send truly unmolested, custom HTML has solved issues that other systems could not handle.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is by far the easiest platform I have used for eCommerce CRM! I love the ease of segmentation, custom events, and analytics. We recently began utilizing the catalog feature and are absolutely blown away by the results and personalization we are able to achieve without any additional effort! Additionally, the support we have received from Iterable is truly far and above anything else I have experienced!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I do think that there is some lifts that can be completed in terms of reporting and catalog UX. The catalog UX is not super intuitive based on the JSON nature of things, but once you get the hang of it, it is fairly easy to implement within campaigns.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Being able to send super targeted content to our large list of users has dramatically increased channel conversion rate and revenue. Additionally, we are able to leverage infinitely more personalization data points through custom events with no major lift on the CRM or Web end of things!

Additionally, the support we have received from Iterable is truly far and above anything else I have experienced!

Implementation process was super smooth and we were assigned out own implementation consultant. Our CSM is super knowledgeable and responsive. In addition to live chat support, we're able to get the help we need within a few minutes.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There's a lot of technical nuances in workflow building that can be difficult to understand.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer engagement, retention and monetization.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable has been a great tool for building and optimizing automated campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has helped us automate many things that were previously done manually with another ESP and custom set-up. Our CSR has become a valuable addition and consultant for our team.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Some new features are not quite 100% there yet, for example the new experiments 2.0 feature. Also the reporting dashboards in Iterable could be better, we are having to replicate many reports in Amplitude that we can not automate in Iterable. And it would be great to be able to duplicate dashboards between users and save them as templates!

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable is helping us build several automated campaigns based on custom events from the back-end of our website, utilizing dynamically populated data. Iterable is also helping us coordinate a multi-channel marketing strategy.

all_reviews.review_title: A lot of unique features, execution is often lacking
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is a powerful tool for creating personalized, highly impactful messaging across email, push notifications, and SMS. Through powerful features like Data Feeds, Catalog, and Template customization with Handlebars, we are able to create campaigns that deliver unique value to each of our subscribers.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Although Iterable has many great features, the execution of many of these features is often lacking. To be fair, everything works, but you will spend a lot of time reading and re-reading documentation. And if the documentation is unclear, and it often is unclear, you will also spend a lot of time with the Iterable Customer Support Team.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable enables us to send highly personalized and targeted emails, push notifications, and SMS campaigns. We are able to accomplish this with the Iterable platform through an integration with our CDP: Segment.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
You can basically customize what data and what triggers you want for your journeys to your hearts content. There's also a lot of documentation so your engineers/devs know what to do

Great for big teams that need to collab on campaigns together

What do you dislike about Iterable?
A lot of aspects aren't user friendly

-When you download data from the reports dashboard, it splits each campaign's data so to get the full picture you must add all the pieces yourself. Tedious
-When you run experiments, trying to figure out the winner seems impossible. I don't necessarily need a bunch of graphs, I need to figure out which option won the test.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We need a platform for automated and blast campaigns for both push and email and Iterable fits the bill.

review_question_answers.answer: We need a platform for automated and blast campaigns for both push and email and Iterable fits the bill.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has an abundance of different channels to reach your audience all in one platform. As a small team, we need to be able to use one platform that reaches our audience in a multitude of ways (push, email, in-app, popup, etc). Iterable has all those tools in one platform and there isn't a need to export data continuously to segment and reach those audiences.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The only downside of Iterable is the turnover of customer service reps. THey are all always helpful, but it seems you get switched to a new rep every few months and need to refamiliarize each one with how you specifically use iterable.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable lets us segment our audience and find out which channel best serves which person for our messaging. Also as a small team, it's easy to work with one person.

What do you dislike about Iterable?

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool that leaves me wanting more
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable does a fantastic job in getting messaging out quickly, along with handling important integrations with our product so it stays up to date with the latest user info.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The UX and UI could be a lot better - many tools similar to Iterable consider how businesses will interact with their systems. That does not seem to be the case with Iterable. all_reviews.review_content:

The catalog function has helped significantly with personalization in our campaigns. We've really enjoyed how easy it is to run experiments for creatives and copy. Also, excellent support from the Iterable team!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Some UI functions can be improved with campaign labeling, segmentation and reporting. It would be great to have more functionality to organize lists and campaigns.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Personalization for 16+ languages can be very complicated but the catalog function has really helped with this. This helps us decrease manual hours working through languages and other personalization fields.
- Experiment function is an ease to use and the reporting is very helpful to see exactly what is doing well in your campaign. We've really enjoyed the heat map function of Iterable!

Additionally, the platform is easy to learn and use and has powerful segmentation and analytics tools.

review_question_answers.answer: Some of the reporting in Iterable leaves something to be desired. Some extra reporting features such as clearer holdout group reporting and multiconversion campaigns would really help round out the suite of services.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Iterable is helping us move very quickly! We are an organization that is in need of fast turnarounds on many campaigns at once and the software always supports our needs.

all_reviews.review_title: Good product, your team inspires loyalty
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- I love how intuitive Iterable is. I train marketing managers on how to use it. Often they are scared to learn a new tool, but they pick it up so quickly, and can create compaigns on their own with confidence after a single session with me.
- Your account managers are amazing! They are so helpful, and I'm always learning new things from them. Shout out to Andrew Uh and Derek Baines!
- Very stable product. You innovate at a reasonable pace, making changes to the website in a logical manner such that no one gets lost when things are moved around.
- Everyone at Iterable is competent

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- Sometimes it takes years for desired features to make it into Iterable. I started using Iterable in 2019, and some features I know were being requested by many customers are just now getting in. For example, rate limiting (I think you are calling it send frequency) is now in Beta, and I'm working on getting opted into that feature. While it can be annoying to wait, I've never been disappointed by a feature that Iterable released.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable is helping me manage dozens of user journeys across our product. We do a lot of experimentation, which our old system was not very good at. The main benefit of Iterable for me has been the speed and ease of deployment. I support over a dozen marketing managers (I'm in deployment), and I'm able to outsource more of the journey creation to them. Because they are more intimately involved, they are able to be more creative with their campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
What I liked best about Iterable was how much I could do with lifecycle marketing that removes the need to cross-collaborate with engineers, data scientists, etc., to launch campaigns.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The downside in the past has been the inability to have a unique identifier outside of email. That was the case when I used Iterable in the past; however, now I found out that's been fixed! We can have a unique identifier outside of email that helps with unknown users. It's been over a year since I used Iterable, and now coming back to Iterable, it is fascinating to see this problem fixed.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Having a holistic approach to a marketing automation platform is what I enjoy about Iterable and being able to message a recipient at the right moment. Fundamentally, it is essential to curate the correct type of content for our users.

all_reviews.review_title: Lifecycle platform built by lifecycle marketers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable allows for a more sophisticated data structure and lets us deeply personalize our campaigns across multiple channels. Their AI features are getting better and enriching the customer journey through personalization. Iterable is far and away the best email marketing tool I've used.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The feature release schedule can be a little slow. It also requires extensive engineering support to get full usage out of the more robust features, but that's probably unavoidable. The native reporting capabilities are underwhelming and not intuitive. Also, if you're looking for a one-stop-shop email tool, Iterable only excels at 1:many email campaigns. For 1:1 email campaigns, as in sales enablement, you'll need a different tool.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We need to communicate with our customers and nurture prospects throughout their journey. Iterable allows us to segment by any metric we use to deliver the right experience to the right contact.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable's journey builder tool is comprehensive, powerful, and fun to use.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Still requires me to get support from internal data engineering resources. Which, to be fair, all marketing automation systems would. But it's even more painful with Iterable, to know that you're so close to doing a thing but you "just" need the data pumped in.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable enables me to keep software developers focused on software development, and not to constantly get pulled away from work that only they uniquely can do. Marketers can do their thing with fewer barriers.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Overall, very easy to learn and use. Solid functionality and customization for all our marketing automation needs. The open API infrastructure helps with system transparaency and the ability to see everything that is occuring in our platform and connect to other, external platforms. Support is very responsive and always willing to jump in to find work arounds or innovative solutions for anything not directly out of the box.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Built-in reporting is a bit lacking, especially at system-level and data hygiene needs. We also find aggregate system reporting a bit circuitous, but Iterable is continually improving functionality and interface. While the open API allows for custome integrations, not having out of the box connections to major other platforms adds a layer of complexity in looking at 3rd party connectors or leaning on our engineering team to build connections.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automating messaging out to all customers and partners based on activity is crucial for our business model. Platform integrations help reduce manual intervention and increases efficiency and productivity across our team.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
We have found Iterable to be a great partner in pushing the boundaries of our we think about our data. They have listened to our needs and worked to find solutions that fit our business, even if they aren't off the shelf. The on-call support team is excellent. I also very much appreciate exposure to the annual Activate Summit.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Our business is not Retail so some of our use cases push beyond the norm and the vast majority of our use cases start with phone call not via a web form or web site visit. I would appreciate more proactive strategic outreach and a standing quarterly business review with recommendations pushing us beyond the limits of what we know and accept.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Migrating legacy processes to a single automation platform, ensuring a more repeatable approach and consistency across workflows. We are also using Iterable to test the interaction of Email, SMS and Direct Mail workflows.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy-to-use ESP with flexible and versatile tools and impressive customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is a straightforward platform that can do a lot. Its engagement and personalisation features are great and customer reps are responsive and supportive. The UI is easy to use and they don't over-complicate their tools.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
As Iterable is still growing, it doesn't have some of the tools other ESPs provide (like preference centres), but they have partnerships with other providers, and I understand this feature, as well as others (like SMS) are coming soon.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're using Iterable to target customers in different stages of their journey. Iterable makes it easy to segment these customers and contact them at the right time with the right information.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is a really comfortable ESP with a cool interface!
In addition, the functionality is amazing. I have never seen such flexible segmentation and workflow in any ESP.
Also, I want to note the work of the support and the technical team, they provide excellent work for the entire infrastructure.
You can be sure that Iterable will be your service for years, after it you will not want to use any other.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I don't see any reason why I can dislike it.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable is constantly improving, based on feedback from its customers, adding new features and functionality. For me, this is one of the best indicators of the level of customer focus. Also ease of use makes the whole workflow easier and time is money.

all_reviews.review_content:

What do you like best about Iterable?
I love that it's easy to create and visualize journeys! The tiles make each step very intuitive and there is always product support when I need it! Additionally, if you need to customize a campaign within a journey, that;s also very easy!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I don't love that you cannot easily build landing pages within the suite. This should be a simple page builder/editor just like we have for email, but it makes it hard for the content team bc we have to use a workaround.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is solving pushing our customers through the pipeline and lifecycle. We use Iterable for lifecycle marketing to communicate with our customers via email and sending their offers on their homes, which is a key piece of our business!

What do you like best about Iterable?
I appreciate the frequency and openness of our weekly meetings, Since we have recurring meetings I know that whenever we run into issues with the platform or want to try out new features, theres very little turnaround with getting responses. Whenever our internal users have reported a technical issue and I've had to get support from Iterable, we've come to a resolution quickly and easily. I also greatly appreciate the assistance I've receieved with helping to ensure deliverability of our non-marketing email systems.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I haven't head any specific issues that would raise to the level of a complaint. From my vantage point (IT) all the assistance you've given has been perfect!

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
The Iterable platform has allowed us to intelligently target email campaigns to customers, while customizing the content based on the end user's subscription status and personal preferences. We get assistance with tracking our campaigns to ensure there are no major issues affecting delivery, while ensuring we're delivering the correct content to each recipient.

all_reviews.review_title: Marketing Campaigns made easier using Iterable
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The key features of Iterable, which creates an edge over other products, are
1. Rich online documentation.
2. Iterable is very user-friendly when creating an email or mobile push messages.
3. Integration with 3rd party softwares like Segment and custom email proxy is a plus.
4. Very prompt and responsive support team.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
As of now I don't have any point to dislike the product.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were using an in-house, custom-built marketing tool, which was not so intuitive and did not provide features for reporting, analytics tracking etc. There was a lot of dependency on the development team(s) to understand the tool's functioning.

The documentation level and time spent updating with every enhancement were too high.

Iterable helped us to overcome the problems being faced with custom tool.

all_reviews.review_title: Robust marketing automation platform with an active roadmap and stellar support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
First and foremost, Iterable's premium support via Slack is some of the best support I've ever received from a vendor. Secondly, this platform honors its name - Iterable's product development team really is constantly 'iterating' on this platform and improving it at a pace that is almost challenging to keep up with. As a whole, this tool lets us accomplish particularly custom journeys via filtering that limits our dependence on our own engineering team. Overall very satisfied with the product.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Reporting is powerful but clunky/doesn't answer all of our questions and we ultimately just refer to connected data in Looker. Could also use an alerting interface given how massive the processes are that we run out of this tool.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable helps us automate over 500 campaigns via 175+ automated journeys across email, push, SMS and in-app channels to consumer and partner audiences. It supports our hyper-personalized dynamic content needs.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The platform is straightforward to use and has a ton of resources to expand your knowledge i.e. iterable academy and iterable rescource dictionary. Unlike any other platform I have worked with, Iterable prides itself on customer feedback, and optimizations are constantly being made from these to improve the experience on the platform.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I'd love it if Iterable continues to work on features a customer can access without the support from ENG internally. There are so many new things coming out this year and when it comes to prioritizing internal optimizations, the hours it takes to implement some of these new resources is tough, especially if they are unique to the business and no impact sizing can be added.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Cross-channel optimizations and communications has helped us improve our user experience. We also have had a ton of success with contact properties that are unique to Iterable such as Brand Affinity! The evolution of the platform is very exciting as new channels and AI features roll-out that I know will make a huge impact on the way we speak to our patients.

all_reviews.review_title: The best ESP on the market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I've worked in Iterable at 3 companies and it is hands down the best ESP out there. A few things I love:
- Snippets allow you to create content in one place and apply it to as many emails as you want. This makes updates SO much easier. No other tool has this feature.
- The segmentation tool allows you to cross reference date and profile/event data, for example, allowing you to create incredibly segmented lists.
- Amazing support. Everyone at Iterable is knowledgeable and very willing to help.

10/10 recommend!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Not necessarily a flaw, but it's helpful to have a dev or someone who knows JSON to really take advantage of the tool.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We need to be scalable and efficient, have perfect targeting, and easily A/B test for optimization. Iterable helps us do all of those things.

all_reviews.review_title: We love Iterable for our healthtech company
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable connects with our tech stack, including our product, to allow us to highly personalize subscriber communications. It is easy to build out journeys, design templates and send blasts. Being a healthcare company, we have to be HIPAA compliant, and Iterable was by far the best HIPAA-compliant marketing suite for us.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
We have had a few challenges around our data integration with Mixpanel. However, the Iterable team is always so quick to respond and great with helping us resolve any issues we have.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable provides us email and SMS capabilities across all of our subscribers, while integrating with our CRM, Analytics and product so we can understand exactly what marketing efforts impact product usage.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The support team and our rep are extremely responsive and helpful without making you feel moronic. The updates to the platform have made creating comms extremely fast and easy to preview, proof, and get quick feedback on. Our onboarding was by far the best onboarding I've experienced in my career. Our onboarding specialist was incredibly helpful and accessible via email and a private Slack Channel which helped me and our Engineers communicate quickly and get us up and running. I do love the data capabilities with Iterable and how customized the user data can be (pretty much anything you can dream in order to dynamically create comms). Reporting has a great UX and is easily shareable via downloading.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
No Salesforce integration or built-in comms preference center (even a basic version) is a bit of a bummer. Yes, there are integrations, but they are fairly annoying extra steps.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have to send specific comms to specific users (B2B and B2C and D2C) and the ability to create lists and segments based on specific data criteria we import and Iterable provides is extremely helpful in error-proofing our automations/Journeys. The fact that we push in our data via the API is important while being able to customize the user data helps us keep comms accurate. We've also integrated a direct mail partner and that set on Iterable's end was very simple. On top of each user type needing specific comms, some of our comms are also whitelabeled and the Snippets come in as a savior to make sure appropriate logos, URLs, etc are as they should in each email but editable in one spot.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- The level of customization for messages
- Journeys are helpful for automating campaigns or blasts/popups
- Drag and drop editor makes building campaigns and journeys easy
- Ability to put campaigns and journeys in folders and subfolders helps with organization
- Being able to have a journey as a draft and then publish changes later is helpful in ensuring they can be approved before launching
- There's a sandbox, which is helpful for trying out/testing messages

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- It would be helpful if journeys could be scheduled to start and stop. I don't remember if this was something that could be done previously but I had a difficult time finding this option.
- When you update the template of a campaign to reflect a different design, it resets the entire message and then you have to retype everything. The ability to update/apply a different design/template to a campaign without losing the messaging would be super helpful.
- It would be helpful if the same template designs from the "live" section could be applied in the sandbox. The same templates/designs have to be recreated in the sandbox, which is a hassle.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
- It helps us send messages to our customers via automation (journey), campaign, and popups. The list builder and different conditions that can be selected are also helpful.

- When you update the template of a campaign to reflect a different design, it resets the entire message and then you have to retype everything. The ability to update/apply a different design/template to a campaign without losing the messaging would be super helpful.
- It would be helpful if the same template designs from the "live" section could be applied in the sandbox. The same templates/designs have to be recreated in the sandbox, which is a hassle.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There are certain limitations when building out journeys such as not being able to use dynamic event data inside of exit rules, and there is room for improvement with certain parts of the product.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
The cataloguing feature has been very helpful to our company in being able to use localization and match users to events near them, which was a very intensive manual practice in our previous platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable is the best ESP (but they still have some work to do)
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is by far the best ESP I have worked with, and I've worked with a lot. They have a great drag and drop editor, the reporting is some of the best I've seen, and the ability to use dynamic content has been unmatched. The support team is always on top of things, and even if they don't have an answer right away, I have full confidence that they will find an answer, and won't stop until they do.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Because Iterable is constantly making improvements, as an end user, it can be hard to keep up with all of those changes. And sometime,s changes are rolled out without thinking about some of the ripple effects they could have on other aspects of the program.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable makes it so that we can operate seven totally different newsletter projects, yet still, orchestrate that data with our internal UI so that we can see beyond the limits of just one of the projects. This is invaluable for us, as we send literally tens of millions of emails to millions of clients each and every month.

all_reviews.review_title: Great user interface backed by top notch customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is well documented and has a visually appealing, intuitive interface while at the same time having the features I need to deliver highly segmented interactions to my audience.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It would be nice to have a universal suppository for all of my content snippets so that I could refer to them across projects. I'd also like to have more control over what days of the week I send emails in journeys without a lot of work-around coding to get there.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using Iterable webhooks in concert with a third-party provider, we are working to set up a program that responds to user behaviors to trigger not only email and SMS but also direct mail to our users.

Constant new & valuable features are being added to keep up with the latest in marketing, and it's easy to design, send, & optimize all your email/SMS campaigns. Working with the Iterable team is also so easy and amazing.

What do you dislike about Iterable?

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I like that iterable is the most intuitive email CRM tool that I've used to date. I like that it's easy to simply copy old campaigns and update them with the new subject. It makes it a great platform to use.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There are often changes that are made too quickly to the interface so it can be a little difficult from time to time to get used to the interface. Other than that, I find that iterable works great.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable is solving the issue of having to send multiple individual emails. It allows us at our company to easily submit list, add and update that list, and send emails to multiple customers without much work to do.

Other marketing platforms do not come close to the level of customer service that Iterable provides.

all_reviews.review_title: Generally good, but parts of it are terrible
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Great WYSIWYG designer, journeys are mostly intuitive, and things generally tend to work.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Experiments are a dumpster fire - you have to go through multiple hoops in order to start one. Completely counterintuitive.

Some of the metrics are useless (e.g. open rates)  given the current auto-open world we live in.

The analytics section was designed by a ferret. It's completely useless. I'd be embarrassed to put out a product feature into the wild with that level of quality.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We wanted a tool that would be dependable for sending notifications. Iterable is generally easy to use in that respect.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has been a great resource in building and executing specialized marketing campaigns. Its capabilities and suite of tools are extensive but easy enough for a marketer to use. I love being able to build journeys, campaigns, and segmentations - all while working within the same platform. The chat function is an amazing feature that allows for instant help solving problems or areas of confusion.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Some platform nuances aren't the most intuitive, even after taking the learning courses. I don't have a coding background, so it is a lot of trial and error to better understand how to get things to work correctly.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable enables us to be incredibly targeted and personalized in creating specific marketing communications and campaigns. With the various API integrations, we can leverage our user's actions to personalize their communications, not only from a marketing sense but also transactionally.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Initial setup is hard. Technology and engineering teams need to work to setup internal events and triggers. No provision to add list via csv file. Sometimes, metrics reported have a margin of 2-3%. Customer service has some issues.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The best feature of Iterable is by far the modular nature of the core structure of customer data. There really is no limit when it comes to the data you can store about your customer, and what this unlocks is a host of industry-leading tools that allow you to build multi-channel campaigns and automations to target these customers.

This, coupled with a simple to use journeys tool and powerful campaigns builder is a great combination to help you better understand, segment and effectively target your customers on a truly personal level.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There's very little to dislike about Iterable. Depending on the complexity of your set-up, initial implementation does require knowledge of JSON and API's, but if you can get your head around this, the platform will work a treat.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's effectively allowing us to learn more about our unique customer needs, and use this data to plan and deliver effective marketing campaigns through both blast and automated channels

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Live chat support is usually fantastic - you get an answer within 5 minutes 95% of the time.

Workflows work consistently well, and are clear to sort out and start new workflows.

Scheduling and building lists are speedy and painless. Iterable seems to deal with large amounts of data with ease.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The platform is going through something of a redesign and some bits still look a bit dated compared to other bits (for example the reporting section)

Occasionally, data ingestion delays can slow down workflows, which is annoying for time-sensitive workflows.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable was our first marketing automation platform and enabled us to set and forget workflows and then come back to them each month to check on successes and make improvements.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- Great at handling complex email and messaging automations with a simple-to-use UI
- Handles marketing and transactional messages effectively. Easy to build content, craft journeys, and ship for both message types
- Very good at compartmentalizing user profile data. Really helps make segmentation logic clear and defined once you're building audiences
- Great customer support team -- they'll take care of you from the moment you begin migration. Even after that's complete, they're available for support and questions

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- Native reporting could use some improvements to better measure business impact. However, if you have other tools that can leverage their integrations or set up external reporting, this isn't much of an issue
- Some add-ons that are useful can be expensive. Catalogs and preference center are examples.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Primarily:

- Marketing messages: helps us send messages to users to activate/acquire them and retain them with out-of-product experiences (email + SMS primarily)
- Transactional messaging: handles all our transactional messages that we send to our users
- Reporting on lifecycle marketing performance: integrates with our other tools to give us a clear picture of how messages and journeys perform and what impact that has on our business

It does all of this with a simple-to-use interface. When things get tricky, you can easily tap into their support team.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable is excellent for B2C Communities
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is an incredibly comprehensive communication platform that makes it very easy to email, send push notifications and text members. Although I would not consider it a very affordable subscription (you get what you pay for), it IS more affordable than many competitors on the market that offer similar complex capabilities. I have done some price shopping for email platforms, and still came back to Iterable for reasons related to both quality and price.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Iterable is a fast-growing company and therefore, has an everchanging platform. If I didn't use Iterable every day, I might feel lost logging in once or twice a month given the amount of product changes that are applied every quarter. That said, the product changes seem to be for the best and tend to make the experience better for me as a user.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable solves the problem of: how do I communicate effectively, in a VERY personalized manner, to every member in our community depending on how they interact on our site? This makes my job much easier because all segmentation and user analysis can be done within the platform, making it easy to send personalized correspondence to members on a daily basis.

all_reviews.review_title: The best messaging platform in a crowded field
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable are rethinking how consumer messaging leads to better communication, higher sales, and more satisfied end users. It's an open box of features where you can build what works for you, without the constraints of a system that needs to work for everyone from your uncle that sells puzzles on ebay to the local hit restaurant that services 500 customers a day.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
My only complaint is that their built in editor (built on BEE) can be a little constraining sometimes and isn't always running the latest build. But it's still stronger than most WYSIWYG editors, and they offer support for fully custom HTML for larger shops that need something much more complicated.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable is letting customers design their communication workflows on their own terms with a very robust API and workflow editor, without trying to cram 100 different features into the platform. Their core value proposition is in messaging, and they have a laser sharp focus on it.

all_reviews.review_title: Awesome customer service and an evolving platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Responsive customer success and support team. Helpful community and forums. Constantly evolving product with new features available via beta prior to the release.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Some features can be buggy initially, but it is easy to provide feedback.  Some features are still unavailable, like the inability to segment as needed and some exit criteria recording and reporting.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Personalization at scale. We still have issues with our data ingestion as our data model is complicated and we need to adjust it to match Iterable's nested data structure.

What do you dislike about Iterable?

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Customer Service has been really great. From moving onto the platform, a few years ago, to growing our lists to where they are today, having access to a support specialist and technical specialists has been by far the most important thing. We joined Iterable after reading the reviews about good support (among other things), and it hasn't disappointed. Having a Customer success manager who understands your brand's needs is key, so you're not just getting spammed with info that doesn't apply to you.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Sometimes there are parts of the back end that Iterable doesn't know so well because it's an out-of-house built module, like the template preview sizing, which we were having trouble with, as it was way off. There's nothing they can do about it as that functionality is not put together in-house.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
I feel confident that iterable is looking ahead. They seem to want to keep improving and building their brand, to stay current and up to date with new trends. This was another big reason we chose Iterable over one of the dinosaur companies like Salesforce.

all_reviews.review_title: Best in class platform with excellent customer care
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable's segmentation tool is unmatched. The capabilities it provides to better understand user behavior are remarkable. Customer care is top-notch and always step in quickly when issues arise.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The new update to UX drastically slows down an operator's ability to ship and edit campaigns. They introduced far too much friction to do the same thing as before. It seems the friction was intended to safeguard some parts of the software, but to more experienced operators, that slowdown has complicated workflows and efficiency greatly.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable serves as a clean and simple platform that nearly anyone can use. In a large business with ever-changing prios, the ability to onboard people and get them sending in a matter of weeks is critical.

all_reviews.review_title: Modern, fast and intuitive CRM platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Modern
Fast
Intuitive
Support is effective
Query building is powerful
Automation canvas is easy
Enables easy multichannel campaigns
Dynamic rule writing is really easy to pick up
Using merge fields is easy
Really clean look and feel across the whole platform.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Can't go back to previous folders. Only back to top level of folders
Can't clone content modules
No custom drag/drop email templates
Reporting suite could be a lot better but most modern businesses use Tableau or Looker, meaning this isn't crucial.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Helping us increase the retention of both our Sellers and Buyers. This retention means we don't need to spend so much on acquisition partners like Google.
Allowing us to easily set up campaigns across key retention channels.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use email tool with variety of features for user journey personalisation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is very easy to use and has a gradual learning curve. With a well-set user data model, which the consultant helps you attune, you can create personalised email experiences. Integration consultants and CSMs are better compared to other SaaS tools.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There were some unmanaged expectations about integration speed and estimations when we'd be having Iterable be able to send more significant amounts of emails. Connecting Iterable to product analytics tools like Amplitude is not working smoothly, as claimed in docs. The tool is still rough around the edges in some aspects, primarily data interoperability with other systems, which adds manual overhead to the email marketing team.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending out more personalised and engaging email campaigns which yield higher conversion rates compared to e-blasts we were able to do with less sophisticated tools.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
1. Iterable is so flexible there are always multiple ways to solve any new ideas.
2. Integration with multiple tools including our own self-developed tools, means that we are able to track the lifecycle of our users, including any action the user takes.
3. Based on this we are able to segment and personalize to each users specific experience.
4. We can fully integrate these actions into automated workflows to make everything easy for our team.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Reporting and analytics is the one area where I think the tool could improve the most. But new features and improvements are being made continuously so I'm sure this won't take long.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our agency was created 2 years prior to implementing Iterable. We were looking for a marketing tool that would allow us to design more sophisticated user experiences based on their behaviors. We were particularly interested in segmentation and automation and Iterable has delivered.
And new ideas we come up with are easy to implement thanks to how flexible Iterable is.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has an intuitive and modern UI, which makes it easy to work with. The chat support that comes with the premium support plan is excellent, both in response times and helpfulness. It also has many integrations that allow users to customize features and add functionality as needed.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The backend engineering work required to integrate Iterable with existing databases is difficult. The drag and drop builder is limited in functionality, making it necessary to know html to design more advanced layouts.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable offers HIPAA compliance and SOC2 Type II security, which was critical for our business. Switching to Iterable allowed us to email more contacts, improving our open rates significantly.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is incredibly fast, incredibly customisable and delivers everything our business needs from an email platform. The onboarding support has been second to none and the pricing is very competitive. You'll need someone in your organisation with some technical skills, or an excellent tech support partner to make the most of it, but if you do have that this is the tool for you.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It's really hard to find things to dislike, normally I'd say the learning curve, but with Iterable, even that is basically not a problem!

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Have a chat - they're super friendly and helpful and they can definitely help you achieve your goals.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our systems are more integrated than ever before and we're able to trigger emails based off events from multiple systems. We've also been able to make it harder for less technical users to make mistakes by limiting their access to data and tools as appropriate. Iterable has enabled us to send better email, to the right people, from more teams than ever before.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Over a year ago, we replaced SailThru with Iterable and couldn't be happier with that decision. Aside from the vast improvement in personalization and automation, one of my favorite features is the ease of integration with other 3rd party platforms through API calls or web hooks. This has allowed us to reach disengaged or unsubscribed email users across social media and direct mail.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
One of the biggest challenges that we face is the level of support. Often we're directed to the library or community, which are great resources for the basics but rarely have examples of the use cases we're trying to build or solve for.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We utilize Iterable to drive customer retention and revenue. It has allowed us to spend less time creating new campaigns and focus more on automation throughout a customer's lifecycle.

all_reviews.review_title: A complex automation platform for Email, SMS and web push notifications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I have been working with Iterable for a year now and I the features we value the most are:
- Catalogs to manage our translations and products. We have presence in over 17 markets and this makes our Marketing team autonomous from the Dev team.
- Custom events to trigger workflows: we use Google Tag Manager to send events and trigger workflows.
- Datafeeds to call endpoints and send the right content to each user.
- 360 user profile, with user data, events and channel subscriptions.
- Drag and drop editor that allows our Marketing team to create cool templates without the need of an HTML/CSS developer.
All these features helps to personalize and segment your audience to a point that you can target them with specific and relevant content at the right time, and what I really appreciate is that we can create a lot of campaigns and workflows with independence from our Developers team.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The possibilities of the Drag and Drop editor are limited. This makes sense because is a third-party solution but it is something that might be improved in the future. We would also like to be able to use a filter in the workflows based on a datafeed answer, to be able to segment in real time.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
I advice Iterable for companies in need of deep personalization and customization.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have improved our personalization and automation, creating new campaigns to contact our users in all the steps of the funnel. The main problem we had with other platforms was that we had a big dependence on the Developers team and this made the cost of new campaigns higher. With Iterable, now our Marketing team can segment, test and improve our email without the need of a dev. This saved us money in salaries and improved our quality of communication, allowing us to test A/B a lot of features, automations and specific email details, such as subjects, content and CTAs.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Senior Director, Marketing and Digital Engagement

all_reviews.review_title: The Flexible and Powerful Marketing Automation Orchestration Layer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has a powerful series of features that make it the premier marketing automation service. We've tested out Sendgrid, Activecampaign and Hubspot and found that Iterable had the best combination of flexible and rich workflow functionality, powerful contact properties, dynamic event capturing capabilities, and the ability to dynamically serve personalized content in email. I'd recommend Iterable to any leading technology or e-commerce company.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There are small things like once a data-type on a Contact or Event Property is cast then it cannot be changed. But thats a small issue. Any issue that i've had (like pushing POST webhooks inside a workflow) Iterable has worked diligently to resolve the issue.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
For enterprise clients -- it's better than Hubspot and Activecampaign!

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's our commensurate marketing automation tool. It sends all of our marketing and transactional mail. Then orchestrates all of our marketing automation retention workflows.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is very flexible and easy to use! My favorite features are the catalog / collections, data feeds, custom events and the segmentation tool. My CSM is really helpful as well, and support is generally good at solving technical issues quickly.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
When I first started using the platform, it took some time to get my head around when to use custom events, API triggers, and scheduled lists to trigger journeys. Would be great to get more training and onboarding support around the different use cases.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem we were looking to solve with Iterable was to reduce dependency on the engineering and analytics teams, so CRM can have more control of customer engagement. We still rely on engineers to sync the data points needed for triggering journeys, segmentation and content personalization, but only for setting it up and managing the integration. Gone are the days of creating Jira tickets for a simple subject line update!

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use and flexible platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Workflow functionality is great, there are many different to trigger a workflow and update user profile data with a few clicks. I like their segmentation tool as well, there are many options to segment and you can see how many users are in the audience and get a detailed list of each. And customer support is pretty good too, they usually answer very quickly with a comprehensive solution.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It's difficult to troubleshoot data feed errors and sparkpost errors, as there is no error log in the UI and only support has access to it. There are also some limitations with catalog collections builder, but it's a great tool as well.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Iterable is a great tool for email and really easy to learn and use.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before we migrated to iterable, we were using Mailchimp/Mandrill, which is really limited in functionality so most of our marketing automation was set up and controlled by our engineering team. Iterable puts the marketer in control, once the technical integration is complete, and makes implementing, testing and optimizing campaigns and journeys much easier and faster.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I appreciate how easy to use Iterable is without being a programmer - very much 'what you see is what you get' for the marketing templates. Iterable's team members are consistently very responsive and helpful and empathetic to our team's concerns.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I think Iterable has a few areas of improvement:
-The built-in analytics and reporting tools are clunky and surprisingly not straightforward compared to the rest of the application. Calculations are unclear and difficult to follow and creating your own reporting for mix of campaigns seems near impossible.
-A few technical improvements (having fake environment SMTP for tests, allowing non gcal attachments, etc) would also be appreciated to really optimize at enterprise level.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving for reaching out to existing users and non-existing users through emails. We have been able to better segment user journeys within our product and within marketing journeys through Iterable.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The platform is user friendly however when we run into serious tech issues that impact our business, we're relying on Slack conversations which confuse the team and cause further issues.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Slack for tech support. When the issue is ongoing and unable to be solved via slack - iterable should take the initiative to set up time with the client to have a meeting and find a solution. No Cancel reporting for PUSH notifications - so it limits the data points we can analyze.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Pay attention to what data points you can collect and measure. We have run into issues with that along with the tech support.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
N/A we're only a few months in and are still learning and understanding what if any, problems it's solving vs. challenges we're running into--hoping to have better insights into additional capabilities soon.

all_reviews.review_title: They offered a bribe for a good review, but never sent me my gift card
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I took over the job of creating a company newsletter template from a designer at our company. I found the Iterable platform easy to navigate, even with no design background. It was simple to upload photos, link photos and sections, adjust headlines, create sections, and perform other tasks to make our newsletter look professional. I liked that I could link not just photos but headlines and even the words "read more" so that the links were failproof, not matter where a read clicked, they found the copy I wanted to guide them to.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I wanted to create specific effects, and at first I thought I couldn't accomplish what I wanted, but after playing around with the platform, I found work arounds. I wanted to create thin white lines between images in a collage. I found that I could do this in Canva then import the collage.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Try it out. Take about 1 hour to play around with features. Look at samples of what others have done. Even if you are not creative, the templates "do it for you." Try all of the custom settings - you don' t have to settle for the basic sizing of photos, for instance. You can adjust them according to taste or your needs.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am able to send out a mass email newsletter that will look uniform in everyone's in box. I had used Outlook before, and recipients complained the images and headlines were uneven and broken. Now, whether our readers access the newsletter on mobile or desktop, it looks great. Also, each month I can update our mailing list easily to add new users and remove old ones.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Although Iterable is a very powerful marketing automation tool, it is relatively simple to use. The Iterable team is there every step of the way to ensure that you have a smooth implementation and that you are using the software to its full potential after implementation. I haven't encountered a kinder and more knowledgeable team than the Iterable team!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The only thing that would make Iterable even better would be a universal exit trigger for workflows so that you don't have to create the exit trigger/filter node repeatedly in the workflow builder.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
If you know that you aren't getting the most out of your current email service provider and aren't delivering the right message to the right segments, don't hesitate to switch to Iterable!

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
With the email service provider that we used before Iterable, we were facing many limitations with the segmentation of our audience. We were truly unable to send the proper communications to the right segment of our audience. Now, we can segment our audience appropriately, set up multi-step workflows that are more sophisticated than previous marketing campaigns, and save hours each week.

all_reviews.review_title: Great idea to switch to Iterable!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
It doesn't take a programmer to get the most out of Iterable. It's all very intuitive, yet powerful. They are constantly updating the product to make it better, and listen to user feedback. In most areas, it is the best ESP I have used, from design to workflows to lists and segmentation. Our engineers state they love the detailed documentation. We get proper attention from our account rep and everyone else at every step of the journey from demos to sale to onboarding. They employ a good crew over there.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
We have encountered a few bugs, nothing overly critical. We have had campaigns or workflows inexplicably revert to an older version before sending a couple times. I have a wishlist of improvements like a global exit criteria for workflows and the ability to make edits to live experiments, but in those cases they have a great forum for that where real Product employees are seeing these and taking them into account. Overall the cons of Iterable are vastly outweighed by the pros.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are currently using Iterable only to manage our email program. We switched in November 2020 and immediately realized its benefits over our previous ESP. Virtually every imaginable task became quicker, easier, and more intuitive, from designing a campaign to forming an audience to building a complex workflow with many steps. The ability to work efficiently has helped our business grow.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for small teams who want to make a big impact
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- Drag and drop formatting of templates expedites template creation
- Easy to set up custom workflows
- The ability to create custom link parameters for every email saves my team a ton of time and error.
- The implementation consultants are SO knowledgeable and helped us create an even better email marketing program.
- Advanced audience segmentation with dynamic lists so we don't have to consistently update lists
- It takes time but Iterable provides the resources to automate most of your marketing program needs.
- Personalization! The handlebar logic makes it easy to ass personalization to every email.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- To get the most out of the product it is helpful to have an experienced data engineer on your team (depending on goals).
- Experience with our CSM has not been as helpful as we originally hoped.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are a small team with a large audience so the ability to automate as many email flows and user journeys as possible is critical. The workflows in Iterable make it easy to visualize and create advanced workflows based on user actions, segmentation, and behavior.

all_reviews.review_title: Using Iterable is one of the best decisions we've made
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is easy to learn, fun to use, and makes my job easier. The support team and our rep are always available to help us troubleshoot and work through any problems we run in to. I also really love Iterable's segmentation tools - it is easy to use and enables us reach the right user at the right time.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It's difficult to come up with things I don't like. There are tools I'd like to see added but those would be nice-to-haves and are not necessarliy needed.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
If you're looking to take your marketing to the next level, Iterable is the ESP to help you. When we switched to Iterable, we were able to run our existing campaigns at scale and create and test new campaigns with ease. Our customer support representative is always available to troubleshoot and they look to us for ideas to make their product better. I highly recommend giving Iterable a shot.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easier to segment our audience. We don't have to run sql queries for each of our sends. Lifecycle campaigns are easy to implement and analyze. Where there's a will, there's a way with Iterable.

all_reviews.review_title: A great tool for building comprehensive customer journeys
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I came across Iterable primarily as an email marketing tool, and I was really excited about it's ease-of-use for building multi-faceted customer journeys. It has an adaptive API and its a fairly user-friendly tool to add to your arsenal - especially compared to similar tools that offer integrated CRM/email marketing/automation capabilities. We also love how easy it is to search for and remove users - in my experience that can be complicated in other ESPs.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It's expensive, and can be cost prohibitive if you're a smaller organization. The pricing is fair, and makes sense, it just means a not-for-profit may not even have the resources to consider Iterable, even though Iterable could be a great way to build multi-channel journeys that are popular in nonprofits (but often very clunky). It also requires a fairly strong technical team to fully utilize its features.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We love it's ease of use with building multi channel customer journeys. It's opened up completely new ways for us to connect with and anticipate customer needs/interests. So the biggested benefit to us are its user journeys, and the visibility it offers for those journeys.

all_reviews.review_title: A super powerful, developer-friendly, marketing automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I prefer Iterable because it plays great with dev teams. From a robust API integration to intuitive segmentation and workflow design, I know it's going to play nice with my back-end database. The really powerful parts of iterable come with their Data Feed and Catalog features. These features allow you to access custom object information in your marketing campaigns and even filter logic based on some fields.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Iterable can be slow if you have a very complex workflow. Their error messaging is also a pain to work with at times. If you have their chat support product, it's usually easy to get answers to your questions, but it is very frustrating otherwise.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
When you need a marketing automation platform to conform to your custom user object fields and complex database, Iterable is the platform to go with. I've found more and more ways to bring in personalization, segmentation, and complex workflow logic with Iterable than any other marketing platform.
