all_reviews.review_title: You can't go wrong with Iterable
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
In my opinion, Iterable is the finest email marketing, CRM, and automation tool on the market. Iterable provides seamless, multi-channel journey curation and can be used to the fullest extent by both non-technical and highly technical marketers. The workflow builder is exceptionally robust. It allows you to create complex automations with ease that enable you to leverage both user and event properties seamlessly. The segmentation tool is probably the most flexible I have ever encountered. Campaign setup is a breeze, and the post-launch analytics are extensive and use-case driven.

From a technical perspective, Its data infrastructure allows it to process vast amounts of data quickly and easily. Millions of records can be sorted and segmented within seconds, and the count is always accurate down to the single user. Iterable also allows the marketer to see the raw JSON of all events that flow into Iterable, so there is no guesswork or need to ping the development team to understand what data iterable is actually ingesting. Integrations are highly flexible, although they do need to be created custom for most connections. During stand-up, the integrators will need to create a user and event schema, but Iterable's fantastic team can help here. Their onboarding professionals, support staff and CSMs, are always timely and knowledgeable. I've done several re-platformings to Iterable over the last two years, from simple stand-ups to the very complex. Every time Iterable's team provided the knowledge, resources, and partnership to ensure all of our client's challenges were overcome.

Whether it's emails, SMS, push notifications, CDP-Lite capabilities, Iterable will almost always be my number one choice. I believe that Iterable has been, and will continue to be, a leader in the marketing tech space for years to come.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Every platform has its little quirks that may be an adjustment to a user getting onboarded for the first time, but I have no major criticisms of Iterable.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
The biggest problem that Iterable solves is it allows users to have comprehensive data-driven use cases from the entirety of their tech stack. Many ESP's have great email and/or SMS capabilities, but very few provide the flexibility to transform companies marketing operations by creating access to data that was previously siloed.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The friendliness of the UI and speed at which the system sends e-mails. Coming from an older messaging platform, Iterable has improved our workflow by making it more clean and efficient. Workflows in Iterable are one of the best features that allow my organization to set messages and revise them without lengthy correction processes.

Lastly, I love the readiness and excitement that our Implementation Rep. and other members of the Iterable team bring to the table each week during our meetings (and during onboarding). Their willingness to go above and beyond in getting us over the hump to transition into Iterable was amazing, and without them I do not believe we would have been able to transition to using the platform as quickly as we did. After initial onboarding, their deliverability experts are not only friendly, but extremely knowledable in keeping our domains healthy and stable during warmup. For the first time, our company feels we have someone treating deliverability as important as many of us on my team do, and they are constantly monitoring to ensure that we are putting our best foot forward as we continue to migrate more and more subscribers into Iterable.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The reporting in Iterable definitely needs improvement. Wide-scale, real-time reporting would tremendously improve the platform, and allow it to become more accessible for marketers who do not live in the world of HTML.

Additionally, allowing for the use of labels to be used outside of just campaigns would be a big improvement. Using labels on lists/segments/workflows, and other select-able items in Iterable would allow for more fluidity in the use of the platform.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are migrating out of a platform that we have used for nearly a decade. We have the ability to segment and target our subscribers in ways that we previously did not with a more accurate degree of certainty and accuracy.

One of the largest benefits of moving into Iterable has simply been migrating into a modern marketing platform. As a solution expert, there were so many times we were limited in what we could provide for our marketing teams in order for them to best acheive their goals, but with Iterable - the options are limitless.

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform to take marketing to the next level.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The extensive user profiles are one of the best features. My company uses Segment to pass through events from our website to Iterable, and our user profiles are populated with every action our prospects and customers take. This allows us to create helpful segmentation based on their experiences with us and send behavior-based messaging.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Platform UI / UX could stand to get an upgrade. Some features don't work as you would expect them to, and that can make the process a little tricky.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Third-party integrations that allow us to pass specific data sets right into Iterable. It will enable us to have omnichannel solutions sent by email, SMS, and push notifications. It can send mails for purchase confirmation, cancellation and password reset.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use and intuitive CEP, but has limitations.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable platform is easy to use and has an intuitive user interface. Easy to create templates and segmentation.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Catalog campaigns have issues and when changes happen, there are negative performance downstream effects that are not factored in and uncovered by the users, instead of the other way around. Dynamic templates are buggy.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Easy-to-use customer engagement platform that makes it easy to create templates and segmentation. Iterable is not the best platform for more advanced personalization and dynamically coded messaging templates.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are looking for an easy-to-use  email and web push creation and deployment that didn't require a lot of technical expertise, plus campaign metrics reporting. For the most part, these benefits have been realized.

On the other hand, as a company, our desire is to grow every day and thanks to Iterable and its multichannel marketing platform, constant improvement and development is facilitated with a view focused on the future of the client.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- Easy Personalization Using Catalogs & Data Feed .
- Easy Dynamic Workflow Implementation, A / B Testing Experiments , Splits , Triggers, Filters and Segmentation .
- Ability to segment users into dynamic and static lists
- Easy Drag and drop for building templates . Flexibile dynamic handle bar logic to build personalize templates based on your customer's contact properties - they provide a lot of documentation for support
- Continuous development of platform / new features every quarter
- Iterable makes omnichannel marketing simple - build push, SMS , email campaigns etc.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- Would be great to have more built in integrations and improved reporting dashboard
- Device preview does not support catalog personalization or complex templates , needs major improvement. It makes it hard to see the final template on multiple devices
- Not the most friendly and simple U. I compared to other platforms

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Personalize recommendations to customers

all_reviews.review_title: Great for enterprise companies, not for startups
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Team was always ready and willing to be helpful

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Way too complicated. If you have a huge dev team that can do a lot of the work, then I think it could be great and really flexible -- few guide rails to stop you from anything custom you want. If you are light on resources and looking for simplicity, it's not for you. It took months just to get the basic tracking and implementation done, and you have to go through their university to get trained on things that other products allow you to click a button on.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Not good for a startup. Could be really great for large enterprise companies with lots of resources.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
I didn't have time or resources to deal with workarounds to get what I wanted done, and ended up cancelling the annual contract early.

all_reviews.review_title: We recently switched to Iterable and I have not learned to love it just yet.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I like how easy it is to search for users. I also like how easy it is to unsubscribe users from certain preferences.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I do not like that emails seem to spam out ( meaning iterable will send the same email to one user 5 times. Also when you are looking at the activity it will show the pt opened the same email 25 times- I think this is a glitch.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
It was very hard to switch our system to iterable. The emails were not connecting, we could unsubscribe from our site and were having to manually do a lot of things. Now that the connection is better, I am a lot happier with the system. But make sure that if you are switching you are ready for the long process..

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
I mainly use iterable for email sends and user journeys. I can see what part of the interaction the user is experiencing. I love that I can see exactly what flow the user is in and what emails the user is receiving. I can also see when they have viewed the email.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable platform that I recommend for its simplicity and operation.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The workflow functionality is excellent and offers us many opportunities for managing our services / products. This software allows us to send different types of mailings; which helps us to send marketing campaigns, it is an excellent option to attract our customers which are adding to our organization, it has excellent workflows, the interface is intuitive and easy to use, you can navigate through the configuration of a mass emailing in a day.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It has some technical limitations, it tends to be a bit slow loading campaigns, saving templates and navigating to different parts of the software, it does not allow you to apply automatic suppression based on sent vs. marketing classification, date matching is not available for this platform, there are no global content blocks that are reusable, non-engineers are not skilled enough to successfully self-service our company functions.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
It is implemented for marketing communications, has a customized on boarding process, is a great tool for companies looking to focus on increasing retention through multichannel messaging. With Iterable we got great help with our marketing needs, through our emails Iterable has allowed our message to reach the direct consumer of our products and helps clientele provide their product/service content.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable we have communications with multi-channel marketing, it helps us for customer retention, it allows design and marketing to be able to increase revenue without having to rely on engineering to edit messages and workflows. It allows us to have omnichannel solutions which is sent by email, SMS and push notifications. It has the ability to send mails for purchase confirmation , cancellation and password reset.

all_reviews.review_title: Ample sales by mail and traffic.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The main objective of our organization is to send different types of emails to obtain more income from promoting our sales. With Iterable we send personalized messages at scale in all channels, we can in turn create campaigns and marketing segments, and even its interface has automation in this field. The workflow has become a more dynamic process traced by ROI analysis, customizable CTAs, Drip Campaigns and Social Marketing.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It is a wide interface but not completely flexible, some of the needs may be limited, so work teams with advanced technical knowledge can feel frustrated. In our company we manage to shake off this negativity thanks to the fact that we develop strategies that lead us to use this software and adapt it to our work flow.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
It offers everything that our company needs to grow in the world of marketing, its system is truly fast in managing and sending emails, monitoring and detailed analysis of the destination and reception of each of these can be established, allowing to capture to potential customers with high odds. Its interface is very comfortable, and capable of adapting to our needs to a certain extent, making the team improve the work flow, and obtain the expected income for each company.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can attract more and more customers through automated email marketing and the opportunities provided by CRM management. We create automatic campaigns that continuously work well in connection with user behavior and user needs. We can work with retargeting campaigns without any complexity, expanding our performance in the market. Thanks to the ability to send messages at scale, we reach more buyers at the same time, creating higher profits compared to when we did not use Iterable.

all_reviews.review_title: Terrific email marketing and newsletter tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is so easy to use, and yet extremely powerful. It has extensive APIs, the ability to merge data feeds into emails, terrific workflows, and an excellent offering of easy-to-use templates. Plus, the customer service is fast, friendly and incredibly helpful.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There is little I dislike. Maybe the biggest complaint I have is that reporting tools are not as good as they could/should be, and that new features are slow in coming. But, the product is so good and so robust that there is little we need from Iterable that it can't already do.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Iterable to send email newsletters and it makes doing so drop-dead easy with powerful features, like personalization and data feeds. It has saved us a tremendous amount of time and has made our newsletters far better than they were.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
As a non-technical marketer, I can use and create create campaigns and emails easily. It gives me autonomy over my work and how fast I can accomplish it. Their support team is very helpful as well when I've run into roadblocks or don't understand how to use a specific feature.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Overall I think their documentation is lacking into how to actually use certain features. Their support articles say what they are, but you need to email back and forth with support to understand how to use it.

One issue that I've had a few times is duplicating blast campaigns, and the previous A/B test duplicates as well. Two times it has happened when I didn't realize it and the email went out with the wrong A/B test. They should make this more explicit - I feel it is a UX problem, not a user problem.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
The primary benefit of Iterable for our company is creating transactional or event/trigger-based emails. It requires a developer to create the event but once that is largely done, a non-technical marketer can handle the majority of the tasks. It is great to not require the use of an email develop or agency to manage the emails.

all_reviews.review_title: An intuitive platform, top-notch support and pleasant experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
There's a lot to like with Iterable. Their workflow builder is VERY intuitive, basically allowing you to customize your user journey however you want. They also support handlebars, so you can get creative with how much you want to customize your email experience on the workflow or on the email template level. There's lots of great documentation on what you can do, so you'll never run out of inspiration on how to test and optimize your campaigns. After working with several other platforms, I've found that Iterable's workflows are by far the best when it comes to ease of use and customiziation.

Ever email a support team for help only to get a generic response that you already googled yourself? Yeah, that doesn't happen on Iterable. All their support team members have a stronger level of technical proficiency. Even if you go to them with a complex conditional logic use case, they will most likely be able to come back to you with a solid answer. Our dedicated customer success rep is also a rockstar who has helped give us tons of insight on how to build certain features to make our email experience seamless.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I think it would be great to have more reporting options, especially because Iterable is capable of building such complex workflows. If you have a data analyst on your team, you should be set as you can pull Iterable's data to build your own custom reports off platform. While reporting on an individual campaign level is great (you can easily cycle through exactly which metrics you want), reporting on multi-part workflows does require more manual work.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable's intuitive UI and features help save us a lot of time - both for our day to day tasks and bigger initiatives. Things load relatively quickly, so you can easily get the information you need. Workflows are easy to understand, so you know exactly what is happening and when. There are other platforms I've used where it's not immediately clear what the workflow will do unless you click into each module due to bad UI.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable Paves The Way for Streamlined Customer Communications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I really like the workflow suite and the ability for us to think cross-channel when we set up campaigns and how customer actions can quickly be pulled in to create unique user experiences.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I'd love a more out of the box solution that wouldn't create as heavy a burden on our Engineering team to also support site assets for campaigns. Right now we have 2 separate tools, and are just starting tee up how system webhooks could work to support.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
In consolidating our tool stack from 3 tools down to 1 we have better visibility to all the customer  touch points we as a company have implemented. This has allowed us to make quicker decisions on what should remain in place and where we can consolidate messages in the flow.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable's platform is a HUGE step up from our former ESP.  We are thrilled that we can now execute multi-touch marketing campaigns all through one system.  We love the web push notifications and SMS integration and the segmentation and personalization capabilities are stronger than what we imagined.  This system is still fairly new for us so time will tell once we start building deep logic with our trigger campaigns but thus far we are very happy.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
We haven't had many complaints yet from the team using the tool the most often so that is a great sign.  The dashboard set up is taking longer than we anticipated (we thought that would be set up out of the gate) but that is a minor price to pay.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our last email ESP, we really couldn't build segmentation down to the user level (everything was campaign based).  We've known about RFM modeling for a while but really couldn't use it before now.  We are just starting to dip our toes into this kind of modeling now but are very excited about the prospects and expect 2020 to be our largest year growth in retention using this new platform.

Iterable's workflow functionality is best in class. Great visibility into logic, flexible, and intuitive UI for business users to create their own flows.

The way A/B testing with templates is handled is a bit confusing. In general, the listing pages for your workflows/campaigns/templates are too simple and could use better filtering/sorting/grouping options.

Especially when having a remote engineering team in a different timezone,  having business-user abilities to edit workflows and deploy blasts is quite beneficial.

all_reviews.review_title: Made for Marketers and Approved by Engineers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Flexible and easy to use API which has allowed us to use more data across our app, website, and database.
Easy to use UI, creating templates, campaigns and workflows.
Easy to personalize messages with dynamic content and segmentation tools
Cross channel marketing working in the same workflow - Able to send emails, in-apps, SMS all in one workflow
Great responsive support, great pool of knowledge and resource center to refer to, and ability to request new features (listen to their customers!)
Ability to automate repetitive tasks like newsletters!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Reporting is good but could be better, such as ability to export and send reports to stakeholders - this is something they are working on!

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Do a demo and talk to them, they work with their customers and were able to help us relieve many pain points. Great people, great software.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to send the right message at the right time to the right user by using triggers based on actions users are taking within our app throughout their journey. This has truly showed us the power of harnessing our data and creating a better experience for our user because it reaches them where they are on the right channel.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- The ability to easily incorporate mobile marketing in workflows
- Handlebars!
- Workflows are easy to understand and build
- Our CSM is absolutely amazing - she checks in with us and provides outstanding support and guidance when we need it
- The support team is always available on chat and email - Rachel and Leah are the best!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Small limitations that add up - like:
- Not being able to search specific email addresses in a dynamic list, it would be nice to save a view of the fields and be able to export them so you don't have to Control F for the fields every time
- Missing advanced filter logic, ability to filter out users from automated workflows, easily see who's in certain automated workflows - the workaround for this is to put these people in a static list
- Email template editor - we use Litmus for this instead. Handlebars can get really tricky to use. Since the email template editor is not as intuitive, it's hard to test the handlebars in Iterable
- No auto-save feature
- Reporting and analytics - we rely on Tableau for this instead
- Customization for workflows and campaigns (i.e. ability to add a description of the workflow/campaign is something that is not available)
- Email campaigns and webhook calls cannot be throttled, causing a lot of failed events
- No drag and drop functionality available
- Cannot create a field in the project settings - you need to upload a list with the new field name instead
- Not a lot of documentation available about push notifications, mobile marketing, etc.
- Iterable community is not as engaged or strong compared to other competitors

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easily send personalized email blasts and create automated email workflows in a user-friendly, intuitive tool. It was incredibly easy to learn how to use Iterable.

all_reviews.review_title: Multi-Channel Marketing and Constantly Updated Features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The User Interface is very sleek and flexible, allowing you to choose from a variety of different template builders.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I wish there was a place for notation in the nodes. I would also like to see increased search functionality where you could search for words in a Campaign or Template name without getting them in the exact order. It would be great if there were a customized foldering system for campaigns, templates, and snippets. It would be great if snippets and workflows could be cloned across projects.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have brought several platforms together on Iterable which allows us to manage the customer livfcycle in a centralized location and allow us to trigger one channel based on the behavior in another. We are using Iterable to trigger events based off of user behavior both on and off platform using custom events and user and event attributes. We are using Handlebars to create highly targeted messaging that takes advantage of technologies like API feeds and integrations with platforms like Amplitude. We are using experiments and A/B testing to test and optimize our marketing programs for optimum ROI. We are using snippets in order to increase production efficiency and organization.

Having a much more helpful hands-on deliverability team help ensure good inbox placement.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Pass in an event and it'll be there on a unified customer profile forever. Leverage that information for advanced segmentation or run a workflow and use it in any number of ways. You can even process that event and add date to customer profiles from the workflows. Email, SMS, In-App, Push Notification - I've even used it to orchestrate programmatic direct mail. And they don't stop innovating and adding features.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Some of the reporting features leave a bit to be desired, but they're making progress on them. The data structure can at times be rigid once set because it's designed to be fast. Just need to be a little more careful in implementation than you might normally be with setting events, field names and such.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
If you need workflows and data retention, there's no better solution.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable is top tier tech which helps our company grow and become more "enterprise." Omni-channel orchestration of the customer journey and lifecycle are core to the success of our (and every) business and they let us do that in a way our previous platforms couldn't.

all_reviews.review_title: Strong functionality leads to robust workflows.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The ability to integrate your company's data within Iterabe allows for the ability to get very creative with targeting and segmentation.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
As you build out more robust workflows, data can sometimes get lagged in running the processes and can lead to delays in comms being sent out. This tends to only be an issue on larger and more complicated workflows - I wouldn't expect the average user to run into these issues very often.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been able to use Iterable to help us be more data-driven in our approach to marketing campaigns. Being able to A/B test within a workflow makes tracking the results of various campaigns a breeze.

Iterable is an extremely powerful engagement tool that my team uses on a daily basis to send personalized, segmented and automated communication to our users. The support team is very efficient and one of the key differentiating factors, in my opinion, is the ability to create complex workflows and connect them, via webhook with our own database.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
UX and analytics could be improved and are not the best when we compare to other customer engagement tools. Implementation was not easy and there is a steep learning curve to understand how to use the product.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Consider the implementation time

The ability to send personalized communication in a scalable way to 2 million users...taking into account each user is different and has a different behavior and interests.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use ESP with tools to personalise
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- Drag and drop building of campaigns makes it easy to pick up and teach new colleagues the tool.
- The dynamic handlebars make even the most complex personalise simple to understand - you'r'e only limited by your creativity.
- The snippets allow us to combine html creative with the drag and drop system.
- Workflows are easy to understand and build.
- Great account managers who are always on hand to help.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- The heatmap doesn't work as it should which can make looking to see how users interact with emails a manual process.
- When working on complex templates it can become a bit buggy and slow.
- An auto-save would be a nice feature.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Iterable is a great ESP for effective and personalised CRM.

- Servicing our users personalised content in a simple and effective way.
- Great UX and ESP solution.

all_reviews.review_title: The perfect platform for medium to large sized businesses ready to expand their email strategy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I really like that Iterable has the toolsets for fairly entry level email marketing applications, with the ability to expand into fairly sophisticated enterprise solutions. That structure allows us to be very comfortable with building very long term relationships without concerns that we'll outgrow the platform anytime soon.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The platform is very API oriented, which is really important for the ability for you to grow the platform at your pace. However, there are a few items only accessible via the API that can create unnecessary friction for smaller teams with limited developer resources spread across multiple projects.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Pad a little developer time into your deployment calendar. Iterable customer success teams are really fantastic about making sure that you get the fundamentals correct, and sometimes that requires a little trial and error with how you import and design your data for long term growth.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're starting to feel very empowered by our user data and Iterable is helping us scale our email strategy . The journey has been slow, but going into the second year of our contract, we've nailed the basics and now are starting to plan for much more sophisticated use of our data and campaign funnels.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable a great investment for marketing professionals
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I love Iterable because since I started using it the product has improved a lot and has become more innovative. I am pleased when my team needs product changes, as they are ready to listen to my needs and do their best to improve it. It has a clear, adaptable and comprehensive interface to build the automation of the campaign workflow.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I can affirm that the most painful part of Iterable is the design of templates versus messages since sometimes it is a nuisance to edit a template and make it not be reflected in a message the way you thought. On the other hand, it can have different projects, but there is no order on a project. There is no control panel for several projects to check trends in those projects.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
For us Iterable is a great tool for B2C companies that want to focus on increasing retention through messaging between channels.It is ideal for companies looking for an email client that can automate complex marketing campaigns and anyone who needs campaign flexibility or unique campaign characteristics.

all_reviews.review_title: It adapts to the competency market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is so flexible that there are always multiple ways to solve any new idea. I also like it since I can segment and customize the specific experience of each user. Something that is very useful in this program is that the integration with multiple tools, including our own development tools, means that I can track the life cycle of our users, including any action the user takes, which makes us have greater reach with the client and greater prominence based on control.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Sometimes when you search for campaigns, a campaign does not appear in search results that do exist and must be displayed as search results. You must refresh the page several times to make it work. It happens very little but when it happens it is tedious. Two other things that I will say, is that I would like to have more sources available when using the drag and drop function. I would also like templates and campaigns to self-save.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Iterable is an improvement both for you and for your company, I believe that you still have a lot of room to grow. It fascinated me a lot and my colleagues also. It is worth mentioning that if you are executing a medium amount of complex workflows and segmentation this program could help you to have a greater development. It is made for big challenges.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Iterable,  we been fulfilled since we were looking for a marketing tool that would allow us to design more sophisticated user experiences based on their behaviors. We were especially interested in segmentation and automation and based on this we have had very important results in the last months. With this tool the company adapts to the market and is ahead of its competitors in this sentid.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to Work with, and amazing follow-through
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
We have a very challenging business model and we require so much customization. From the day we started to talk to Iterable in sales they produced a whole mock up to work with our business, and then did a brain-transfer to the Implementation team when we joined. If we ask something and they don't have it they work to make it happen. Truly an amazing team!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Its a pro and con but there are quite a few ways to get to the same answer so its hard to direct what the best solution is at times.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Whitelabling in a way that would allow us to send different messaging to different groups of people but not overlap messaging. Benefits is that the sky is the limit and if something doesn't exist right now, it doesn't mean there is another way to do it, or that feature is never going to happen. (like with some other platforms)

We've been able to create campaigns that exactly suit our business and are excited to finish all of our integrations so that we can use all of the tools that Iterable makes available.

What do you dislike about Iterable?

In the past, our company has run email campaigns very manually. Using Iterable's multi-channel automation means that we can accomplish more with a smaller team, and our smaller team is able to analyze results and make decisions quickly. We can adjust with the market and get ahead of our competitors right out of the gate.

all_reviews.review_title: One platform to rule them all
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
We use Iterable to send out all comms to current customers no matter the channel and treat the customer like a single person not a variety of different channels. It's super easy to coordinate channels and build journeys to walk customers through the purchasing phases. Our data takes just seconds to process despite being a large volume and everything is so easy compared to older ESPs.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It's still a young platform and they are still working on the reporting suite. However we import all the data in to our backend system so we can manipulate it there.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Buy It!

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are trying to optimize retention rates by driving more personalized messaging to the customer. We have see a very positive trend in GMV and are able to continually optimize and tweak to get even better results.

Now a few years down the line, their partnership has not diminished but has only strengthened as our rep routinely gathers our feedback and we see meaningful product development that solves for our ever-decreasing list of painpoints.

Driving job applications and job seeker (consumer) and employer (customer) retention.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable has been a gamechanger for our marketing emails
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
First of all, the UI is really easy to understand and navigate - setting up a campaign is straightforward unlike in a lot of other email service providers. All the features are useful, especially workflows for automation.  Segmentation is great too, and allows us to get work done without needing assistance from our analytics teams. Overall I would highly recommend them to other email marketers.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Sometimes when you search for campaigns, it won't pull up a campaign in the search results that does exist and should be displayed as a search results. You have to refresh the page a few times to get it to work. This happens probably 30-40% of the time when searching campaigns.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable allows us to quickly segment users, send them emails, set up automated email campaigns quickly, and learn and iterate on our campaigns with a/b testing and analytics. It saves us a lot of time, since without them we would be stuck depending on our developers and analysts to get anything done to send an email campaign.

Overall I would highly recommend them to other email marketers.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Iterable allows us to quickly segment users, send them emails, set up automated email campaigns quickly, and learn and iterate on our campaigns with a/b testing and analytics. It saves us a lot of time, since without them we would be stuck depending on our developers and analysts to get anything done to send an email campaign.

all_reviews.review_title: Lots of features and integrations to help facilitate campaigns across multiple channels
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The flexible API structure and accessible endpoints allow rapid exchange of data; the UI is easy to navigate and the segmentation tool (though there's definitely a learning curve) provides great insight into our audience's behavior.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There have seemed to be miscommunication between sales and the account managers on a few items - we expected the insights capacity to be fully integrated when we onboarded, but it was still in beta.

Also, the lack of built-in deliverability tracking within the platform has been a bit of a struggle but we're in the process of solving it.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
The warmup and transition period was smooth and we had plenty of support and a ramp-up plan that was easy to follow.  For any snag we've hit, there has been a solution - though some of those have come in the form of third-party vendors at an additional cost. Before committing to ANY new platform, please fully consider your needs and build out several use cases to ensure that you're accounting for any additional functionality beyond the built-in scope of the product.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Utilizing the API endpoints to marry user data + behavior with on-site traffic trends and data from other channels for a higher-level view of cross-channel activity.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has the best in class workflows and automation features, as well as extremely robust APIs. The tool is extremely easy to pick up and offers one some of the strongest flexibility in integrating with other tools and platforms.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Lack of integration with Shopify and Magento, particualrly when compared to other automation tools. Their internal reporting tools are also not that strong, however they do allow you extract everything via Webhook which helps offset this if you do your reporting in Looker or another tool (which a lot of our clients use).

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Iterable is one of the strongest mid-market tools in the automation space, largely driven by their workflow tool and strong integration with Segment.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
For most of the clients we have helped migrate to Iterable, they were solving for a more complex workflow automation tool that could better send data back to their system and push data up. They were previously using legacy systems that required syncing a database, which didn't make sense given they were using Segment.Io or some other ETL tool to manage their data. In addition, the tool is about 50x more intuitive and marketer friendly, while still having many of the same, if not better capabilities than enterprise level tools.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
drag and drop ability when mocking up email creative, and the list management and segmenting features make mailchimp almost unusable once you become accustomed to iterables interface. The workflow creation and management interface is excellent, allowing much of the day to day work to become automated. Also, the "help" intercom system that allows an iterable operator to chat in real time with a iterable representative is outstanding. This has honestly really been a lifesaver in many sticky situations. Their reps do a great job. The UTM feature in the advanced options is also a great tool that allows for easier segmenting and reporting, and it quite simple and easy to use.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
the merge tags can be sorta finicky sometimes, but even then this is nothing when compared to the other issues ESP's have. sometimes the drag and drop feature can have some glitches. Sometimes the button formatting can be a little off set, with the button sometimes being too small for the text.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
do it. mailchimp is trash.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
quick, clean, and easy segmenting of users who sign on. By using workflows we are able to segment by survey responses so that a user, depending on their given answer, receive a unique autoresponder email or series of emails. This allows much of the day to day work in the past to be automated, freeing up vital time that allows our firm to optimize our time thus increasing profitability.

all_reviews.review_title: Great email service provider for creative and data-savvy email marketers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Love how creative we can be with our complicated data. Iterable lets us use workflows, blast campaigns, and API triggers to send highly personalized and beautiful emails. The experimentation framework is pretty robust, so we can learn quickly, and the analytics UI is pretty good (and always improving). Furthermore, the Iterable team have been good partners when we've had questions or concerns, and I really appreciate how technical they are since our team is very technical.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There have been a few major data breakdowns over the past year that have hurt our sends. We're also currently dealing with some data load issues as we've increased the volume of data that we update daily with Iterable. There are some bugs in their experiments framework and analytics UI that are annoying, but far from dealbreakers.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Be clear with your Iterable rep about what you want to accomplish -- I think we have been successful with Iterable because we shared our business goals, data, and our strategy with them. They are great business partners and will work hard to find creative solutions if you're communicative.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're sending more personalized content to our users, and how flexible their system is has allowed us to test and learn rapidly and apply those learnings to other parts of our business. We're currently using their API trigger functionality to also transition other teams' emails to Iterable, which allows other teams to work more efficiently.

all_reviews.review_title: Has potential,  but is a little clunky
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- The flexibility of the tool is unreal, which is mostly due to the data model/elastic search. Ability to reference data objects is great.
- Great functionality through the API
- BEE editor integration for email templates
- Reasonable Segment integration

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- Navigation through the product is pretty clunky
- Reporting is sub-par, but we don't really use it anyway. Reporting in most email/marketing automation tools leaves a lot to be desired.
- Template/Campaign management is confusing at first. Not intuitive at all.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Be prepared for a pretty steep learning curve.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Standard marketing automation best practices
- Dynamic product recommendations for customers
- Movement of consumers through the customer journey

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I love the access to their CX team via chat. They can help me find what I am looking for quickly and are generally very helpful. I love their workflow capabilities and that you can now see aggregate workflow data.
Because they are smaller, they really care about their clients and their needs. They are always improving their software and adding new things that make my job easier.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
They are a smaller company so they are still working out some glitches but all in all, they are helpful in addressing our concerns when we have issues. Hopefully as their team grows those glitches become less and less common.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable allows multiple team members to work across multiple projects easily. We are able to manage drips and campaigns and it's very user friendly which makes onboarding new users easy.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The drag and drop feature is a great tool for fast email creation and no need to HTML knowledge.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
I wish there were more fonts available while using the drag and drop feature. I would also like templates and campaigns to autosave. It would also be awesome if you could quickly edit the HTLM in the drag feature rather than having to export. Their workflows need a lot of work. More triggers to actually start flows would be great. They JUST launched a reporting dashboard and would like to see a lot of improvement there such as being able to export reports.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
iterable is an improvement for us but it still has a lot of room for growth. If you're still with a small-medium company it's probably fine, but if you are running a lot of intricate workflows and segmentation I would not recommend iterable until they are able to improve both their workflow and reporting dashboard.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a need to send to an extremely large list and were noticing campaigns randomly stopping because our old ESP could not handle the workload. Early benefits - able to pull more analytics and see trends.

We are using emails to bring in revenue and repeat customers.

review_question_answers.answer: I really have a hard time with the way lists and work flows are set up. It takes a lot of logic (and backward thinking) to get something done and often doesn't give you the result you want until many iterations. I also wish we could upload our own fonts. I never use the analytics dashboard because we all the different types of campaigns our business runs (multiple countries, multiple parts of the business) it's difficult to narrow down.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We are using emails to bring in revenue and repeat customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Great features that allow marketing team to be empowered, but still some rough edges
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The workflow/journey editor has quite a bit of flexibility and customization -- allowing marketing teams to take raw data and yet operate very complex segmentations.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Even though the journey editor is complex by nature, some of the segmentation is overly complex. For example, emailing customers 7 days after a purchase is very difficult because selecting 'on a date' is timestamp specific. The workaround is to pick people 'after 8 days ago' AND  'on or before 7 days ago'. This is an example of a rough edge. Nonetheless, the team is building out more features fairly consistently to solve these problems.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
All of our email marketing and transactional emails. This allows our eng/development team to integrate once with a platform and marketing team to mostly have all the flexibility they need without further eng requests.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable Gives Other Marketing Automation Products a Run For Their Money
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Our company has been using Iterable now for over a year to service the needs of our clients. Iterable's layout, organization, segmentation functionality, ease of use, and ability to build complex workflows for drip campaigns are by far the best features.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There are few aspects of Iterable I dislike. As far as limitations go, there are a few when using Iterable at an enterprise level (like the ability to clone projects and clone workflows across projects). In spite of these limitations, the Iterable team has always been highly responsive, is aware of the above limitations, and working to correct them.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
If you have/service multiple markets and are looking to use Iterable in a way where you wish to re-purpose workflows for other markets, be aware that you will have to rebuild each workflow. This is because Iterable is still lacking the functionality to duplicate workflows and/or clone projects.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We employ an omni-channel marketing automation strategy that integrates social media, direct mail, and email channels. Iterable has helped us define our segments and maintain consistent communication across all three channels.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Head of Marketing Operations, Design, and Brand

all_reviews.review_title: Impressed with the breadth of functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
We chose Iterable based on the strength of its API and its ability to handle a multi-million list size. As a marketer, Iterable has a number of powerful advanced features that make it easy for me to perform segmentation, write workflows and run multivariate tests. The support team is beyond amazing; they are knowledgeable and go out of their way to ensure their customers succeed.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Our engineers get a bit frustrated about some of the technical limitations. For example, certain types of API calls are currently centered around the individual user vs. a particular list (meaning that Iterable is designed to ping your server X million times for each user on a list vs. 1 X for the list itself). That said, the Iterable product team is very responsive to customer feedback, and this issue is on the short-term roadmap to be fixed.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
I would highly recommend Iterable based on the strength of their support team. They have bent over backward to ensure the success of this implementation.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Prior to using Iterable, we had a homegrown email-marketing system. Marketing had no ability to send emails or to get detailed metrics without engineering support. Iterable has allowed us to reduce time-to-market for getting sends out the door, while improving testing and metrics reporting. For our most recent product launch, email marketing powered by Iterable was the top revenue-driving marketing tactic.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Two things:

1.) The workflows are super easy to create.
2.) The ability to run multi-channel retention/conversion campaigns out of one platform is great: e-mail, SMS, push and Facebook Custom Audiences.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Support is a little non-existent.

1.) There is very little help with onboarding - just a bunch of guides
2.) Support is really only available via LiveChat and takes upwards of 30 minutes to get a response sometimes. That said, once you can get someone on LiveChat, they are amazingly knowledgeable and supportive. The only downside is if you have a campaign all queued to go but need to wait for a response.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Make sure you have a solid technical implementation team. Most onboarding is left to a series of guides on their site.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking to get more intelligent with our nurture campaigns, transitioning off of Mailchimp to a better product for automation.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy Automation with Highly Personalized Messaging
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable's data setup. First I've seen to use customer objects instead of relational data tables. Makes personalization really easy and robust -- I can sync any customer property I might have into Iterable and can filter users, dynamically personalize, make journey decisions, and more based on these properties.
Also Iterable's workflows -- easy to setup triggers and intuitive to use when building out customer journeys and decision splits. Also like that the journey is easy to visually follow once setup, allowing other team members to be able to easily hop in and interpret what's going on.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
All pretty minor things in the big picture...the fact that user PK is email address instead of being able to custom set what we'd like it to be (we have userIDs that we'd prefer to key off of), inability to rename a property once passed in due to Elastic Search, lack of support for common functions in handlebars (this is a simple fix, but lower priority), lack of handlebars support in Snippets, inability to create a globally applied automatic suppression list (to the whole account, or by send classification - transact vs. marketing).

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Definitely recommend Iterable for it's ease of use and UX for marketers who aren't super technical. However, if you're a former SFMC power user like myself, you may find it lacking in some areas. For me, certainly none of them were deal breakers, and I find that I can still do most of what I was able to through SFMC, albeit in a different way.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Mitigating user churn and increasing retention. We've been able to build out phases of our customer lifecycle through workflows to help engaging with our users and are running many A/B tests to gather additional learnings and iterate. Still in v1/v2 for many of our drips, but looking forward to implementing learnings and further improving our lifecycle through use of Iterable's great features.

Also Iterable's workflows -- easy to setup triggers and intuitive to use when building out customer journeys and decision splits. Also like that the journey is easy to visually follow once setup, allowing other team members to be able to easily hop in and interpret what's going on.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Iterable?
review_question_answers.answer: All pretty minor things in the big picture...the fact that user PK is email address instead of being able to custom set what we'd like it to be (we have userIDs that we'd prefer to key off of), inability to rename a property once passed in due to Elastic Search, lack of support for common functions in handlebars (this is a simple fix, but lower priority), lack of handlebars support in Snippets, inability to create a globally applied automatic suppression list (to the whole account, or by send classification - transact vs. marketing).

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
review_question_answers.answer: Definitely recommend Iterable for it's ease of use and UX for marketers who aren't super technical. However, if you're a former SFMC power user like myself, you may find it lacking in some areas. For me, certainly none of them were deal breakers, and I find that I can still do most of what I was able to through SFMC, albeit in a different way.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Mitigating user churn and increasing retention. We've been able to build out phases of our customer lifecycle through workflows to help engaging with our users and are running many A/B tests to gather additional learnings and iterate. Still in v1/v2 for many of our drips, but looking forward to implementing learnings and further improving our lifecycle through use of Iterable's great features.

all_reviews.review_title: The Best Growth Marketing Tool You Will EVER Use!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I seriously cannot say enough amazing things about Iterable. It is a fantastic tool that yields powerful results and has completely revolutionized the way we execute email marketing. It allows for far more sophisticated email list segmentation and trigger email / drip marketing campaign development vs. our previous Email Service Provider. And the level of customer service is beyond anything I've ever experienced. I feel like its a real partnership, which is a great feeling.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
There are still a few things the company is working on, to improve functionality--they are a start-up after all. But the company is adding new capabilities every day (and has already implemented some things I hav requested), so it'll only get better!

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Iterable is more expensive than MailChimp (or other similar email service providers), but the benefits FAR outweigh the benefits. Iterable has already paid for itself and then some!

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Overall, it has helped us better segment and target our users, better identify and capitalize upon points of demonstrated interest in our product, and allow for more impact drip email campaigns. Not sure if my company wants me to share exact numbers, but let's just say that its helped increase purchase conversions, overall user engagement and email traffic by a VERY considerable factor. I cannot recommend this product more highly!

all_reviews.review_title: Best ESP in my 10 years of email experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
- Data flexibility: we can integrate SO MUCH DATA and insert them into emails pretty easily.
- Their team: their team is awesome, transparent and so easy-going. So unlike the stiff corporate teams I've faced with other larger ESP's.
- Workflow tool is awesome. So much you can do with this and all pretty easily.
- I also love that my engineers love the tool!

What do you dislike about Iterable?
- It's a "startup" ESP, so there are small kinks they're still working out. Their team is always happy to listen and I like that I can impact their product roadmap with my feedback.
- Their reporting suite can use a makeover. It's not that intuitive and is pretty lacking. I just end up exporting my data as a data dump and doing my own pivots instead.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Don't get sucked into the big-name ESP's. Most of them are deceitful with their sales tactics and will tell you everything is easy to do. Iterable has been the most transparent with me and most honest with how our integration will work and also their weaknesses of the tool.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed to find an ESP that would let us integrate our user data WITHOUT a flat-file integration.
We're a search company, so we need to be able to efficiently pass over all the user search results AND the properties of those result items into our ESP and have the marketing team easily include those result parameters into an email.

Our engineers love the API integration (we don't send any files back and forth!). I use the tool personally, and it has a LOT of options to accomplish one thing. As a marketer, it can be very confusing but it's pretty simple once you get the hang of it.

The workflow tool is also awesome, especially because there are so many data points you can integrate into the workflow. You can even build a workflow from an API trigger, so all your dev team would have to do is set the API and the marketer can build an automation with the rest.

all_reviews.review_title: The only modern retention marketing suite
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Our developers like Iterable because it has the best APIs for handling programmatic message from our internal stack, and our marketers like Iterable because of the power and ease of the visual Workflows feature.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
No complaints so far. When we have had feedback about the product, Iterable have been lightning fast at addressing it.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Prior to Iterable, we had a very decentralized and disjointed retention messaging suite (one ESP for marketing email, another ESP for transactional, another vendor for marketing push, and Amazon SES for transactional push). With Iterable, we're migrating all those messages into one central service. This allows us to construct a much more holistic experience for our customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for anything that isn't SaaS
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is a great service for simple drip campaigns as well as large data crunching. They are flexible with best in class tools like Segment that allow for powerful segmentation as well as creating dynamic content.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Their email template tool is open source, meaning any changes needing to be made to it require them submitting a ticket that could potentially take months. They really should invest in a proprietary solution that allows for high resolution and retina support.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Really think about the issues you are trying to solve and the systems you are Integrating with as they will play a major role in what limitations you could potentially face.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving mid-end funnel conversion problems, drip campaigns and the workflow canvas is a powerful tool they provide. Benefits also include the fact they are extremely flexible with how they ingest data so you can do just about anything (if you can think of a potential solution to make it happen).

Exporting email statistics data is easy because you can set a date range. It makes it very easy for reporting purposes. You can also find out how many new emails are added using segmentation under users, but it takes some practice to figure out how to set your preferences right.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It's difficult to import lists. In each CSV I have to match up the fields exactly how Iterable wants to have it import correctly, which is time consuming. The new template structure makes it easier for people who don't know CSS coding, but makes it more difficult who do know how to code and customize templates and unique emails.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
It's worth the switch. If you're used to another software, consider this if you're fundraising for political candidates.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable integration makes it easy to track in Google Analytics, which is helpful for reporting purposes, although this requires work on our end to make sure UTMs are correct. It also integrates well into our donation platform, Revv and our donation processing platform, Stripe. Once again, this is very helpful for reporting purposes for our clients

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable has really taken our email marketing campaigns and automation to the next level. Using the workflows has allowed us to create a real relationship with the people on our lists without tiring them out from endless asks or asks that don't pique their interest.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The biggest issue we've had has been with the import process. Our company had to build our own import plug-in and profile editor to ensure no data was being mishandled in the import and editing process. It would be very helpful to have an easier way to update profiles (i.e. first names, last names, zips, etc.).

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Iterable has truly been a revolutionary product at a fair price. We use it for a variety of clients from political to corporate to media and have had great success. The team is professional and easy to work with.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are having more meaningful interactions with our potential donors and activist. In the email fundraising world, we're hitting our lists aggressively as we build up to a particular event or Election Day. By using appropriate workflows and dynamic workflows to suppress those who give or take action for several weeks, we prevent burnout and retain more emails on the list in the long run.

Emails are assets for our clients. As we acquire more emails, the longer we can retain those emails, the more value our list has in the long run allowing our clients to get a bigger bang for their buck.

all_reviews.review_title: Iterable EMS is the best out there
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The flexibility of the entire system and the entire team. The customer support is unlike any other EMS I've ever worked with, and it's a game changer to have people on call at almost all hours of the day that are skilled in the space and are helpful in getting things done.

As far as the system goes, everything from the workflows to the complexity in each and every trigger. It's extremely helpful in making automation a priority for email marketing, and I'll never be able to use a different EMS.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Sometimes change is good, sometimes change is bad. I think that for the most part the changes happening on Iterable are fantastic, but sometimes the user interface changes without a prior warning and I'm thrown off. Other than that, I honestly have no complaints.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
If you are considering getting into the email marketing space, or you are in it and are looking for a different platform to execute your strategies, Iterable is the tool to use. Not only is the customer experience and support incredible and solutions-focused, but the technology is far more advanced than other EMS platforms. All in all, it's the tool you want an need for your company or yourself to better your email strategies.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
My company is mostly focused on email fundraising in the email marketing space. Utilizing the Iterable platform in ways where we can personalize emails with hard data makes a difference in our efforts.

One of the biggest goals we had when we wanted to use Iterable was how do we create an automated workflow that is still personalized for each and every user on each unique list. With workflows and complex triggers we've been able to solve those problems and implement extremely unique email marketing techniques for the betterment of our clients and their efforts online.

As far as the system goes, everything from the workflows to the complexity in each and every trigger. It's extremely helpful in making automation a priority for email marketing, and I'll never be able to use a different EMS.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Iterable?
review_question_answers.answer: Sometimes change is good, sometimes change is bad. I think that for the most part the changes happening on Iterable are fantastic, but sometimes the user interface changes without a prior warning and I'm thrown off. Other than that, I honestly have no complaints.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
review_question_answers.answer: If you are considering getting into the email marketing space, or you are in it and are looking for a different platform to execute your strategies, Iterable is the tool to use. Not only is the customer experience and support incredible and solutions-focused, but the technology is far more advanced than other EMS platforms. All in all, it's the tool you want an need for your company or yourself to better your email strategies.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
My company is mostly focused on email fundraising in the email marketing space. Utilizing the Iterable platform in ways where we can personalize emails with hard data makes a difference in our efforts.

One of the biggest goals we had when we wanted to use Iterable was how do we create an automated workflow that is still personalized for each and every user on each unique list. With workflows and complex triggers we've been able to solve those problems and implement extremely unique email marketing techniques for the betterment of our clients and their efforts online.

all_reviews.review_title: Great customize-able CRM tool, easy for both developers and marketing managers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Workflow tool allows us to easily set complex rules that would have been impossible or required months of engineering work in a different ESP

Easy-to-use data export API's allow us to create custom dashboards on our end that tell us how well our campaigns are doing

Handlebars is easy to pick up and learn

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Some basic features missing since the product is still in development mode, e.g. folder structures

Some tasks are a bit un-intuitive and have led to minor bugs in our system, e.g. having to always edit a template within a campaign rather than being able to edit a template itself

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Great tool for both engineers and marketing teams

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Segmenting our users into different categories and sending them tailored email/push based on their segments
Sending personalized, event-triggered emails to users as soon as they take certain actions

all_reviews.review_title: Top tier product with great service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The product itself is the biggest selling point.  Integrated email and push allows us to have one hub for messaging users; of the players that offer both push and email, Iterable has the most developed email service and best roadmap for future advancements.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
The primary key for data is a user's email address rather than a User ID or something else that could be determined by a customer.  It led our dev team to some hacky workarounds.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Iterable is relatively similar to Kahuna and AppBoy, but it's definitely more expensive than either.  If email is an important part of your business, though, Iterable is the only one that treats email as a first-class channel rather than an afterthought.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Iterable has workflows that will allow marketers to more easily edit transactional/automated emails.  We are able to get more complete data on our push notifications, and we have greater ability to test variations of automated emails.  By virtue of having a consolidated platform for push and email, we are able to realize some cost and time savings.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
I like how helpful support is, and how quick they get back. i also like the platform, it's open enough with simple APIs so we can build whatever we want.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
In workflows, creating a new email. Seems to make more sense in my mind that you can select an existing email/template you have in the triggered tab. On the final page before hitting send on a blast, the estimated audience size is way off for us (lots of segments, lots of unsubs). There are no built in geographic/zip code segmenting tools (target using radius within XXX location column). To create an int column data first needs to come through API csv upload makes numbers string.

Recommendations to others considering Iterable:
Great platform, amazing team of great people. Awesome fast support. We use the API to build whatever we want and do cool things for our clients.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We find value in workflows. Email is easy enough for campaigns to send press releases and blasts themselves. We are trying to build more tools and find more value by sending all online data to iterable (donation, web visit traffic, survey data) and then using that to better segment and raise money. We have had great deliverability and thanks for supporting SSL DKIM, most of our competitors use ESPs that now give ssl errors. We've also built out petitions that send custom events to iterable (rubenforcongress.com/petition/save-social-security) and so far pretty much any problem/idea/feature we have that could add value for clients we have been able to build with iterable as the base CRM/ESP/tool.

all_reviews.review_title: The product is good however the Api is not evolved enough
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Workflow emails triggers and simple segmentation

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Api are not documented well and missing batch event Ali

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
The reporting tools. These have been extremely helpful in post email blast analytics.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Sometimes unclear posting instructions. When starting out I personally had some issues with scheduling that has since been resolved.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
How to maximize click throughs in our email campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: So far, the best email platform I've ever used.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
It's easy to use. Easy to get templates setup. The staff has taken to it very quickly.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
No specific complaints up to this point.

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use iterate for email marketing and fundraising.

all_reviews.review_title: Great customer service and great product

What do you like best about Iterable?
Iterable is truly easy to use and fool proof. We have never had a problem getting support and help from staff.

What do you dislike about Iterable?
It would be nice to integrate my AWS acct

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Iterable?
Very robust Workflow tool, really nice Segment Integration, very responsive customer service. Competitive pricing

What do you dislike about Iterable?
Iterable can benefit from more robust roles and entitlement schema

What problems is Iterable solving and how is that benefiting you?
Multi-product, multi-voice marketing communication.
